Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on outskirts”
Reviews.Author: Jamie_Maidenhead
Reviews.Content: We were 3 kids and 3 adults travelling by car. Hotel was easy to find and parking was easy in the car park under the hotel. Rooms were nice for adults and kids - clean and practical. Shuttle to and from metro very convenient. Breakfast was GREAT. I guess business people use this hotel a lot as we saw a lot of suits - but it was perfect for a touring family like us too

Reviews.Title: “Easter Break”
Reviews.Author: tinab460
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a short metro ride into rome, free shuttle bus from hotel to metro station you can buy the metro tickets from hotel reception. Good clean hotel really helpful staff, we ate at the hotel on an evening and really enjoyed our food good value for money. Nothing around the hotel to enjoy of an evening. Breakfasts great.. Spotless hotel enjoyed our stay,

Reviews.Title: “Great for a bit of luxury on inter rail!”
Reviews.Author: robbo1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night in September 2011 as part of inter rail. We got the room for barely €100 for a night combined - not bad for a 4-star hotel in Rome at the end of peak season! As I arrived before my friend, I had some time to take in the surrounding area. From the centre of Rome or from Termini, this hotel requires a metro then a bus, or a short train ride but it is situated a few hundred metres from the FS station if you decide to take the train direct from Termini. The metro/bus is probably the better option especially if you have luggage. The area is quite quiet as it is about 13km from downtown Rome. Predominantly local families who, while maybe not overly friendly, are keen to help out should you become lost (as I did, rather embarrassingly at the back of what turned out to be the hotel itself!) The room was lavishly equipped and the bathroom equally so. Air-con worked fantastically and provided a good night's sleep - ideal as we had both been travelling the whole day! Although I feared the beds were joined together they were in fact singles which could be pushed apart. A good night's sleep therefore ensued. Breakfast was included in the fare and was decent enough. Maybe not as good as other hotels of a similar calibre but let's not forget the price tag. The only real gripe I have with this hotel is its shuttle bus. Merely a Mercedes Sprinter with panoramic windows, it did not show at its appointed time in the morning to take us to the Metro station. Clearly running on Italian Summer time i.e do a no-show! For us this wasn't a massive issue as we had prepaid public transport tickets for the duration of our stay in Rome, but many others were left very frustrated at having to travel on (and no doubt pay for) a public bus. The main road was about 300 metres from the hotel, thankfully slightly downhill. The bus service into Rome and towards the Metro station is fast and frequent. For the money I would definitely stay at the Capanelle again. The price resembled that of 4-star hotels a few years ago, whilst maintaining that good old fashioned charm of a well-kept privately owned hotel. I can also see it being an ideal hotel for those who come to Rome by car but who don't want to drive within Rome. If I couldn't match the price again I would search alternative hotels but at the time of booking the Capanelle, I had seen 2-and 3-star hotels nowhere near as cheap. Bravo Hotel Capanelle, you have one very satisfied customer here! Forza Roma (e Capanelle!)

Reviews.Title: “Mr Octavius AIME”
Reviews.Author: Octavius A
Reviews.Content: WE were thirty three people in that hotel, VP tour was paying you for thirty three people one in your receptionist made me paying for one more person, please you need to send that credit to my account as soon is possible. and also i already file a complain before my bank . Please let me know as soon is possible, my email oaime1@yahoo.com and your hotel is very nice Octavius Aime

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, athough a bit of a trek but doable.”
Reviews.Author: scubapaula
Reviews.Content: Right this might turn into a monster review but bear with me if you are planning on staying at this hotel. The distance from the Fiumicino airport and the hotel is quite far about 30-40 mins and will cost 55 euros in a taxi. Make sure you agree a price cause they will rip you off. And beware that they drive like nutters. Just close ya eyes. The hotel itself is very nice. The rooms are big with all you need but the room I had the shower was a nightmare and the toilet was a bit dodgy. But all in all a nice hotel. One thing that did annoy me is that if you get a room with a balcony you can’t open it. You have to phone reception and ask them to open it and then ring them again to ask them to close it as they won’t give you a handle. On average it took about 4 rings to get them to open and close it. Not very good at all. Staff were friendly enough but not that helpful when it came to information about getting into town. So the easiest way was to get the bus to the metro line. The bus stop is out the hotel and turn left then next right and you can see the main road. Then it’s the first bus stop you see its yellow. Bus will come from the left. Get on the bus and stamp your ticket. Then you have 75 mins to get to where you want to go. Plenty of time really. The 664 and the 663 are the buses to get. The 664 is the easiest as the 663 goes all round the houses and you have no idea when to get off the bus to get to the hotel. So I would recommend the 664 to the Arco di travertine metro stop. You can also get off at the Colli Albani which is the next stop along on the bus. The metro is really easy to use as there is only 2 lines to go on. For tickets the hotel sometimes has tickets so buy then when you can but the ticket machines at the stations are easy enough to use. These cost 1 euro for a 75 mins trip on either bus or metro so get it all in in one hit and its quite a bargin really. There is a shuttle bus that goes from the hotel to Cinecitta but the times are not very good and I would just hop on the 664 bus and go in that way. The only problem you might have that I did was knowing which stop to get off at on the way home. The area is quite open and so when the bus goes from being surrounded by shops and houses and is built up to looking open and green. Then get off you can also see the ruins which gives you an indication where to get off the bus. The stop is just after a hotel which has a big green sign. The food in the hotel I found not very good at all. I did eat there a few times and wasn’t really impressed. The breakfast was very good though with a lot of choice but can get really busy at the weekends when you have to queue to get in the door. Also if your on your own like I was be careful they will clear your table away when you are up getting a glass of orange juice. There is a happy hour between 5-7 when the drinks are half price. So a beer is 2 euros which is much better. There are local ruins that you can go and see but its 6 euros to get in them but they are just across the road called Villa Quintilli. There is a local supermarket just up the road. Take a left out the hotel and walk to the end of the road which is about 2 mins away. The staff are friendly and the shop itself is well stocked. The water is much cheaper than the hotel. Hotel will charge about 90 cents for water which isn’t too bad but the shop is about 15 cents for a bottle. If you are buying wine then the staff are more than happy for you to open it there so you don’t have to worry about it back at the hotel. But I did find the hotel were happy enough to open it for you aswell. A good bottle of wine was about 2 euros. Bargin. Also I did find Limoncello for 3.60 euros. Which was too hard to resist. The trip into Rome itself from the hotel is a bit of a trek but its easy enough and as the hotel was cheaper what do you expect. It will take about 40 min if things turn up at the right times. I was there on business so we had a course in the hotel all week and then we did manage to get out in the evenings to have a look round. I would say the conference part was ok but they moved us after 2 days of being in a certain room and things kept going missing like pens and drawing boards and the projector was changed. Which did drive out course speaker a little mad. The rooms were not well air conditioned either. And when we had coffee breaks and lunch at the hotel they were never ready for us. Which when you are only given 30 mins for lunch and things arent ready makes lunch really rushed. If you need help with transport I found this site really helpful http://www.atac.roma.it/ just plug in 664 and it will give you the route and times. BIT – biglietto integrato a tempo – bus and any metro line 1 euro BIG – biglietto integrato giornaliero – daily ticket 4euro BTI – biglietto turistico integrato – 3 day travel ticket As long as you leave an hour each way to get in and out of the city its fine for public transport. But you can get the bus in and then if you want to stay out late get a taxi home. Should be about 15-20 Euros for the trip. I hope that this has been helpful for you. Enjoy Rome is a lovely place. So much to see and do there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very poor location”
Reviews.Author: Brandon B
Reviews.Content: Pros: Hotel is excellent. Nice room, excellent service, great breakfast, reasonable prices. The hotel in itself is 5/5 rating. Cons: Unfortunately the location makes it very difficult to get around. While the area seemed to be safe, it is 1.5 miles to the nearest metro stop. There are two options to get there (outside of walking of course): The hotel offers a shuttle bus that runs like 6 times a day - in the morning and late afternoon. Or, the city bus runs all day. However, the city bus is extremely confusing and has long routes. The result is that we couldn't go out to the main city for dinner or evening activities and had to plan our day around the shuttle times. If the hotel would increase its shuttle runs, this might not be a problem, but as is the location is a limiting factor.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel but so isolated”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris N
Reviews.Content: (+) nice hotel, spacious rooms, always clean and tidy, fine service, great food in restaurant, friendly prices in bar. (-) location. location. location if you do not have transportation things become tricky. hotel offers shuttle services but it is hardly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Roma!”
Reviews.Author: adventurous3
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a quiet beautiful neighborhood. But very far from tourist attraction areas. Though the shuttle was always on time. Romantic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: DamienMcD
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 , we stayed in the Capannelle 3 days before our cruise from Rome and found it great value as it was close to the airport and the hotel shuttle to the tube station was always on time. The metro was very easy to guide you to all of Romes main attractions. The breakfast buffet in the hotel was excellent with cereals fresh fruit and bacon eggs and sausage and good coffee. The one complaint i would have is there is not a lot around the hotel but as you are out most of the time that is not a problem as the rooms are clean and comfortable and the big plus is the pool is great to come back to after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice !”
Reviews.Author: Fatima B
Reviews.Content: First, we reached the hotel late at night , via bus 663 from Colli Albani bus station . The stop is very close to the hotel , so it wat super easy to reach their. Then, the restaurant was closed ( closes at 10:30) , but they led us to a pizzeria behind the hotel. About our stay , the room ( Executive Double ) , was very clean and of high quality of furniture and bathroom. Super calm stay ! Breakfast is served from 7:00 am , and of various choices , 5 stars ! All in all , Enjoyed our stay ! and the shuttle bus was handy if your plan meets their schedule :D ! highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay with Capannelle, and we love it too.. Highly Recommended and we will definitely stay there again..!!”
Reviews.Author: Upeksha E
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Capannelle recently during our rome visit. Its bit outside from city centre of rome but the hotel shuttle service provide very well service to the nearest metro stations and so transportation is not a big problem. Even the local buses are coming very near to the hotel. As well as they provide airport pick up service and drop- in. The area of the hotel situated is very calm and quiet so it’s a good place to stay away from noise and can have a good rest to busy lives. I love capannelle cus it is beautiful hotel with exceptional service. And good value for the money we paid. Staff is very friendly and helpful too. The rooms were very comfy,relaxing, spotless and spacious. We stayed in a double room and it was perfect and no words to explain about it with a nice and shining bathroom it makes so lovely. The Room was big. And the beds were huge and very comfortable too. Every day when we returned the room was clean with fresh beddings, towels and everyday with new toiletries. There was a lot of wardrobe and drawer space, minibar and a writing table with a flat screen tv which can be use as a computer as well. But we used hotel wifi connection and its nothing to complain with the speed of connection. The continental breakfast buffet has an endless range of food to be had; scrambled egg, sausages, croissants, bacon, Cake, Coffee, Tea, Juice and fresh fruit.. etc.. All the foods are tasty and fresh... its much more than we expected! We wished our stay had been longer than 4 days as we felt in love with rome and hotel capnnelle made it lovely too. We highly recommended this hotel to the rome visitors and we will definitely be coming to this hotel when our next visit to Rome.. Thanks Cappanelle..!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and situation”
Reviews.Author: Yves B
Reviews.Content: We had rented a car and the covered car park of the hotel was free(rare in Rome). The room was cheap and very clean and recently furnished. Near a city by pass which led us to all the poi's in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a Lifesaver!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: swarttav
Reviews.Content: In the recent snowstorm we were stuck in Ciampino airport for about 15 hours - no information and no one cared. I saw the bus from this hotel pull up (one of the few vehicles even out in the snow) and asked the driver to take my wife and I back to the hotel. We were desparate and I knew nothing about this hotel - whether it would be 100 or 1000E per night - we did not care as Ciampino was h--l!!! The bus driver was courteous and the hotel a God-send. They extended every courteousy to us in a time of real travail - the wait staff were outstanding - I had fun teaching them to make an american style VD martini. The wi-fi was unwaveringly good. And they rendered every necessary assistance courteousy and professionally, I know Rome and understand the location isue - but this was among the best and most courteous staff I have ever dealt with. The rooms were clean, large and spacious. The front desk advised me how best (read least expesensive) to make the numerous international calls to rearrange plans and obligations (my mobile had died on top of eveyrhing else). I cannot speak highly enough of the professionalism and courtesy extended by the staff at this hotel - and I travel a lot! And it was 49E per night and they only charged us half rate as we checked out late instead of staying a whole second day. When I return to Rome rest assured this will be my choice at any price,

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with large rooms and very large and comfortable beds. Very helpful staff. Free parking and wifi. Breakfast quite rich with excellent coffee and warm croissants. Sometimes you have to wait 20 minutes to find a table to sit at the breakfast. The refrigerator and the dryer were not operating normally. The hotel is far from the city center but very close to the Airport Ciampino. With the shuttle bus takes 10 minutes to the metro station (Coli Albani) and from there to the city center about 20 minutes. The period we went to Rome the shuttle bus was not very often due to the Christmas holidays. The main reason I chose this hotel was the price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you'd think you weren't in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 1hotam
Reviews.Content: Capannelle is a great place to base your stay in Rome as far as what a hotel should provide for travelers. Great breakfast choices (I could have taken home the granola they served...so good!), comfortable bed, spacious bathroom and sitting room, pleasant decor and furniture, easy access points to other floors and entrances, restaurant on site (we did not eat there), sofas in the lobby, free WiFi, friendly staff, free parking, and a 5 minute free shuttle ride to Colli Albani Metro stop. The others that reviewed this hotel regarding its location I agree with. It takes a while and some patience to get to the city center. We took the shuttle once to the Colli Albani Metro stop. More frequently, we used the 664 bus to/from the Arco Di Travortino Metro stop to get ourselves to/from the city. We had to be flexible the first full day of our travels in Rome due to a transit strike. We walked around the area of the hotel, walking along Via Appia Antica (beautiful!) and nearby streets, photographing Villa Quintilli and the aqua ducts, eating at the local restaurants, and trying to mix in with the locals. I have mixed feelings about staying here again, simply because of the location. Would I pay 30 Euro more per night to stay closer to the city? Maybe. If Capannelle was closer to the city, I would definitely book a room.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel even though outside city centre”
Reviews.Author: hill16ontour
Reviews.Content: First the location, stayed here for 10 nights august 2011, at that time some metro stations were closed due to works so free shuttle from hotel left you at bus stop at metro station where shuttle buses provided by metro company took you to central train station (termini) This took about 40 mins but was fine,I am sure it is quicker when metro fully operating we arrived from Fiumacino Da vinci airport which is about 30km used roma cabs who were excellent with great english speaking drivers well worth the 50 euro and were met at terminal On couple of occasions got taxi from central Rome cost about 20 euro which was fair shuttle bus can be busy so make sure you are there 10 mins before departure as odd occasion some people left behind (never happened to us) Facilities : lpvely covered bar /dining area near pool where you can sit out in fresh air (yet not get sunburned very relaxing pool is small but fine Restaurant is nice but limited menu nice sandwiches for lunch staff friendly nice restaurant il gisrole about 10 mins walk on main road in outdoor garden Breakfast was excellent and very efficient large choice one of the best i have seen on Continental europe Rooms are clean and nice and bright patio doors are locked for some weird reason but not a issue, only problem we encountered was our room safe which was quite old and after one day lock jammed, rang reception and after a while said would have to replace safe but in end were able to open it with some oil and had no problem afterwards staff very nice wi fi available but did not bring lap top but free internet terminal available at reception on production of passport not a hassle as was free i do not why people complaining about this after all most hotels can charge 10 euro a day. by the way can buy bus /metro tickets at reception 1 euro each for 90mins travel which saves standing in line at metro stations In general great hotel if do not mind little more travelling to city it was nice to get away from all the hustle and bustle of Rome Central staff nice great English.

Reviews.Title: “Location sucks but great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: girlgnome
Reviews.Content: The breakfast has an awesome selection for all the picky eaters out there. The complimentary shuttle runs to Colli Albani metro. However, I strongly suggest using the 663/664 buses which are way more reliable and goes to Arco Di Travortino metro. We had problems coming back to hotel each night so consider quite some distance walking from whichever stop the bus drops you off. Staff is snooty but it's funny to watch them.Overall, great hotel room size for Rome and free wifi makes up for the bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay outside of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Roccoandhisbrothers
Reviews.Content: You need to have a car if you want to fully enjoy Hotel le Capannelle, since it's far from Rome city and downtown. By the way building is brand new and modern,(also inside furniture), rooms are large enough either single or double room, business style. I've been staying for 1 nigth last week and I've been satsfied about room, services and staff. Location is ok and if you need to go to city centre there is a free shuttle which will bring you there in approx. 30 minutes, it depends about traffic condition. Outdoor/indoor pool (small one), outside dehour, free wi-fi in a public areas and parking, meetings rooms. Personnell is friendly and customer oriented; breakfast quality is above the average. I've benn several times in Rome recently, and I've find out this hotel one of the top ranking, (near to Ciampino airport). If you stay in Rome this is one good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Capannelle!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne C
Reviews.Content: Capannelle is a beautiful and extremely well run hotel. It is very clean and very friendly. I travelled with my Boyfriend and we stayed for 12 days. I acknowledge the "Bad Location" reviews but frankly people should do their research before and not leave a stinking review. The beauty of Capanelle is that it is not too far out, but you are in real Rome surrounded by real Italian residents and you are able to enjoy the Italian culture much more than if you were in a very touristy part of Rome for the whole of your stay. Furthermore, the Free Shuttle Bus Service and the extremely cheap metro service Rome offers it is hard to understand why people are moaning!! The value for money and easy access to central Rome allows you to be standing by the Colosseum within 30 minutes. The Shuttle Bus runs all day and as long as you have a timetable (an example of which I have attached) you will be more than fine. It is fantastic value for money. When you first walk into the hotel there is a huge reception (which I have pictured). The breakfast has an endless list of food available: Croissants, Eggs bacon, Cake, Coffee, Tea, Juice the list goes on and it is all tasty and fresh... much more than we expected! The swimming pool is a smaller area but never too and for 3 euro’s you get a clean fresh towel everyday (and you are allowed to use your own) All of Capanelle's employees were friendly, hardworking and all "go the extra mile". The Room was big and clean and very well maintained throughout our stay. The beds were huge and very comfortable and the hotel provide extra blankets incase you need them. Also, it was very quiet at night. The restaurant is another asset to the hotel. The Food was lovely, especially the seafood strozzapreti that I loved and the big complimentary bread basket is tasty. Nearby there is a supermarket that is very small and sells stale bread. But a ten-minute walk up the road and there is a much bigger much nicer supermarket that has a wide range of stuff if you fancy a night in. The general manager is very kind and friendly and always about in the day-time and evening. He makes time for all of his guests. We felt valued as a consequence of all of the staff- including on the front desk, the bar and in the breakfast room. All which have enabled me to write a shining review… We will be coming to this hotel when we next visit Rome. It is lovely!!

Reviews.Title: “BAD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ernest f
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Out of the way. A long way from central Rome. This hotel is in the neighbourhood of an urban area a distance from any main attractions. A free hotel shuttle bus takes you to the nearest underground train station. The underground train station is in shambles, dirty, graffiti and dark so don't be surprised. In actual fact all the stations in Rome look the same. HOTEL: Average HOTEL RESTAURANT: Waiters rude BREAKFAST: Boring and below average ROOM: Average Unable to open patio for fresh air. Every time I needed to open patio door I had to call reception and someone came up to our room to open patio door and again to close at night. We were told that there was only one key for the whole hotel. No shuttle to airport. They only run at a certain time only. WOULD WE STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN?: NO WHAT DID I THINK OF ROME? honestly? If you take away the monuments and shrines you're left with one big dump. Terrible roads and drivers, graffiti and garbage everywhere and rip off taxi drivers. The vatican surrounding restaurants are a rip off. Difficult to find a decent bathroom. I had a bad experience where I ended up at emergency ward in hospital. The bathroom was disgusting, no toilet paper, no hand soap or hand towels. I asked a nurse for toilet paper and he told me that that the hospital had run out. I waited for 7 hrs to see a doctor in a crowed waiting room among older people that were laying down on stretcher beds for hours in pain awaiting to be looked at. Nurses behaved like prison officers towards patients and their family members. They got angry at them every time someone asked how long before they were able to see a doctor. Same with restaurant service. Waiters are arrogant and rude. Terrible terrible experience. I will never return to this city again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: jd1701
Reviews.Content: A nice enough property, I would say between 3 and 4 star quality. The breakfast was very good with many choices, and the rate we enjoyed for 3 nights (€59, €89, and €89) was good. The staff were friendly and helpful. One of the bus drivers was nice, the other seemed like he hated being there. The room was big, clean, comfortable, and quiet. If you want an early start to exploring Rome be aggressive with your approach. Breakfast starts at 0700, and getting to Rome can be a lengthy ordeal. The shuttle bus to the metro that the hotel offers is hit or miss. Perhaps the public bus that's mentioned would be a better alternative. Also, the wifi signal was weak in the room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Hotel in Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: Justcruisin
Reviews.Content: Hotel Capannelle is a clean modern hotel in a quiet area about 30 minutes outside of Rome. The hotel staff were competent but not many friendly smiles/faces (typical of Italy wait staff). There are not many nearby eating establishments but the hotel restaraunt was good and very attentive. They have a nice happy hour between 5 and 7 nightly with half off all drinks and nice snacks. Rooms are clean with modern facilities. Hallways and rooms utlize energy conservation. Hallway lights don't come on until motion dectors see you and room power/air doesn't work until you put your key card in the slot near the door after entering (bit of a pain but probably saves lots of energy). Hotel has free underground parking. Be warned, the entry and exit are the same ramp and can be scary, cross your fingers no one is coming the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a great price”
Reviews.Author: davesax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night during a business trip. I've booked it online at 89 Euros including brekfast, which turned out to be an excellent value for money. The service level is very good and staff are polite and helpful (this is not common in Rome by the way). I've also tried the bar and the restaurant and both were of good quality and again price was fair. The room was spatious, very clean and modern The style is classic/new with marble everywhere and wooden furniture. Should you ask for a downside I would really hesitate to find one. Well, it's not in the city center or in front of a metro station, but I could see Roman ruins from the window anyway ...

Reviews.Title: “New but not a holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: gothomson T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my 50th birthday trip. First the good points the staff are professional and friendly, the hotel is pretty new so all the amenities are fresh and clean. The shuttle bus to the nearest town - Colli Albani ( I may have spelt that wrong sorry!) in on time and efficient getting you there in about 10-15 minutes. Its only a short 10 minute metro to Rome itself. Now the down side. The food is rubbish. I spoke to other guests to see what they thought (we are both vegetarians and have got used to average food) they confirmed our view from a meat eaters point of view and agreed that the food was bland and expensive. Same goes for the breakfast except for one more thing, its cold. I like runny scrambled eggs but it was just too runny for me, plus when we got the lukewarm food to the table it was cold. Also the coffee and juice machines broke down or ran out of coffee. Not good. The rooms: These were a good size, clean, with a good air con and trhe bathroom was adequate. Rooms were serviced daily and restocked with the essentials. The bad points of the rooms? Well if you wanted to stand on the balcony (there were no chairs) you had to call reception, who then sent someone up to open the door - which turned off the air con - and when you wanted the door close to had to call reception to get someone to come up and close it! Weird! In conclusion I can say this is a clean, well run hotel with professional and friendly staff. However I think this hotel is more geared toward the professional / business traveller and is not suited to tourists. Also its location isnt ideal as we had to leave Rome early because the Metro line we had to use was closed early (9.00pm) for upgrading. We decided the next time we come to Rome that we will stay in Rome itself and avoid all the stress of travelling back at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not central - call before taking the hotel shuttle from the metro”
Reviews.Author: vanflygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Capannelle in Rome for 1 night (September 21-22, 2011) as it was close to Rome’s smaller Ciampino Airport (5 km. away), and we were flying back to London the next day before heading home to Canada. We had already stayed in Rome the previous week before travelling to other cities. The hotel is located on the outskirts of the city (about 30 minutes from the centre), and although a bit out of the way, it sits along an ancient route & another important part of the city’s history. Nearby are ancient ruins dating back to the 1st century BC: Villa dei Quintili (about 230 m. away at Via Appia Nuova, 1092), the Roman aquaducts (Via Appia Nuova), the catacombs & the tomb of Roman noblewoman Cecilia Metella (about 6 km. away at Via Appia Antica, 161) Although a bit out of the way, it’s a very nice hotel with great amenities & pleasant staff, breakfast buffet included, free wireless internet, an outdoor pool, a nice dinner restaurant (not included) right next to a bar/lounge. The happy hour is from 5pm–7 pm & attracted many guests like a swarm of locusts. There is one computer in the lobby for guests to use, but you must give your passport to the front desk staff as collateral in exchange for the mouse. A similar procedure may apply if you need an in-room safe, and/or a handle to open the patio door to the room’s balcony (not sure what the reason is for that). There is also a free hotel shuttle to/from Ciampino Airport, & to/from only 1 metro station –neither one of the 2 metro stations (Cinecitta & Arco di Travertino) that the hotel’s website mentions. We took the metro to Cinecitta station, & there was no shuttle or signage anywhere in sight. After running up & down the street, & around in circles while my husband stayed with our luggage, as well as a few unsuccessful attempts to ask people for information, we ended up flagging down a taxi (no easy feat with Italian traffic). Not realizing how close the hotel was, I confirmed the fare with the driver beforehand, but later realized that we got fleeced 20 Euros for a 5 minute taxi ride. When we checked-in we found out that the shuttle stop had been moved to the Colli Albani metro station (1 stop before Arco di Travertino) due to roadwork or some kind of problem near the other 2 stations. You can also take bus 663/664 from the Colli Albani metro to the hotel. The only disappointment was the lack of updated information about the hotel shuttle. If you plan to ride the metro & take the hotel shuttle, call the hotel before your arrival & confirm which metro station the shuttle leaves from.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Would be better to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: cadufelix
Reviews.Content: Despite being still inside the city, this hotel is in the suburbs, far away from everything. You have to take a bus and the subway to go anywhere. Plus, there isn't a menu in your bedroom and they don't provide it, so if you want roomservice, you have to go downstairs to the reception, browse the menu and ask them to deliver it to your bedroom (what's the point?!) Good points: it's clean and new.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yves C
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is nicely situated, about 20 minutes from Rome Center. Breakfast is good, Shuttle bus that takes you to and from the Metro station. Rooms were very nice and so were the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Hari992
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 night and found the room clean and big but room did not have any tea making facility and room did not have dressing table or mirror in the room so we had to rely on one mirror inthe bathroom. Found the receiption not very helpful. Did not give any informaton about the city the shuttle bus and found them rude at times. At the bar one day it took them 1/2 hour to serve us. We had dinner one night and found the food which was served was very poor. Breakfast did not have much varity. They use left over food from previous day. Egg smells, did not have much chose for vegetarians. The potatos were also smelling. Even though the breakfast from 7 am to 10 am found that they started clearing from 9.30 am. We chose this hotel becuase previous good review but we found our experience at the hotel not very good. Swimming pool is very small specially when so many are using it. I would not say this is 4 star but give 3 star. This hotel can be improved if they improve customer skills and quality of breakfast. I am sure there are better hotel then this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: fcbt345
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in September and thoroughly enjoyed it. Although it is a way away from the centre, the hotel provides a free bus shuttle service to a nearby metro station, so it took less than half an hour to get from the hotel into Termini. At times, the bus schedule didn't suit the times we wanted to go into Rome, bust less than five minutes away is a local bus stop where we can get the 664 bus to the same metro station the hotel bus takes us to. We actually ended up using this more than the hotel bus as it meant we weren't tied to the hotel schedule. We bought a 7 day metro and bus pass for 16 Euros and it was well worth it, extremely good value. We found the staff at the hotel extremely helpful, although we did have to ask twice for extra pillows, but this was our only issue. The staff at breakfast were pleasant and welcoming, in particular a Nigerian girl called Lovely, who really did live up to her name and made breakfast an extremely enjoyable experience! The hot food at the breakfast wasn't as hot as it could have been, but everything else was very good. The rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. We had a regular double room and it was perfect. Every day when we returned the room was clean with fresh sheets and towels. There was plenty of wardrobe and drawer space and a nice sized bathroom with shower over bath. Although we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant during our stay, we went for a drink in the bar a few times and very much enjoy it. There were complimentary bar snacks and sweet biscuits on the bar, and a lovely outside terrace. The bar staff were all extremely friendly and attentive, particularly Vincenzo who was always chatty and smiling. The price of the hotel was fantastic for a stay in Rome and we would definitely go back here and recommend it. The distance from the centre meant it was quiet and peaceful, but not too far away from the city. We also went to a nearby steakhouse (La Taverna Del Parco Bisteccheria) which is about 20 minutes walk from the hotel, and was superb - our best meal of the holiday, and so good we went back on our last night. Definitely worth a visit if you are staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: tuntrav
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. We received a warm welcome when we arrived in the early hours of the morning. We were upgraded to an executive room on the second floor which was extremely comfortable. Easy to get to Colli Albani metro by hotel courtesy bus. Just follow the time table (available from reception). By reading through comments from other reviewers, we found we did not need to ask hotel staff anything. There was a good spread for breakfast and that set us up for the day. We also received a friendly welcome from Rita each morning. Outdoor pool was an added advantage. It opens from 9.00am to 6.00pm so we used it in the morning after breakfast. All in all, this is a great base for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Rhondaoxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, with rooms cleaned daily. Small pool but it was perfect for cooling off in ,after a day in rome sightseeing. The breakfast was excellant, providing bacon, eggs, as well as the usual continental breakfast , cereal and fruit. It is a little outside of Rome, but that did not create a problem. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to and from the metro about 10 times a day. The metro costs one euro, and at each stop there are plenty of sights to see. Just up at the top of the road is a supermarket, and to the right are a couple of eating places which are basic but far cheaper than the meals in the hotel which are expensive. Water from the supermarket costs around 20p and in the hotel its about £2.00!! Dinner for two with wine costs about 70 Euros. Its a shame that they dont provide a cheaper menu, as most guests we met went out looking for somewhere else to eat. We only ate there once in the week due to the cost. Before ordering from a menu in rome itself CHECK the price first. We heard of many couples who did not and found they had paid the equivalent of £30.00 for two drinks and icecream!! We found most of the hotel staff were not that friendly. They have happy hour from 5 til 7, when all drinks are half price, so order a bottle of wine before 7, and have it with dinner, or buy it from the supermarket for 3 instead of 18 euros! Rome itself is fantastic, and the map that the hotel provides makes sightseeing easy, as you can follow the metro line on the map. The bed was a little hard, but the room was spacious. there is free 24 hour wifi so for my partner needing to use his laptop was perfect. We had looked at other hotels and some were charging for wifi use 15 euros per day. The 664 and 663 buses run directly back to the hotel from the metro stop Colli albani, should you miss the shuttle bus. Make sure that you wait for the shuttle bus at least 10mins before it leaves, as once all seats are full no one else is permitted on the bus. It runs to the airport early in the morning and the evening. Taxis are very expensive, but as public transport is easily available and very cheap there should be no reason to take one. Would I stay here again? Absolutely. We met people who stayed in far more expensive places, with no pool, no wifi, and basic breakfast, so dont let a 10 min ride to the metro put you off staying here.

Reviews.Title: “great for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: carl h
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the reception staff were helpful ,and we were passed an underground Metro map at which point our hearts sank a little trying to make sense of it ,with the langauge barrier .In the morning things fell into place when we boarded the hotel bus to the designated station with timetable in hand we were dropped off and picked up at times shown . It was great for our euro to the metro we saw all the sights of Rome with only one line either way it was simple to follow just get off at sightseeing stops with a minute between. The hotel food was fine but we found a back street pizzarie which was fun to try.Tthe hotel was modern and clean but being typical Italy 4 euros bought half of lager . There were several mini markets around where they sold pleasant wine cheaply and uncorked it for us to take to our room and watch TV and cheap bars as well bearing in mind this is suburb with no nightlife so the holiday was daytime based around the City. Beware it will cost thirty euros to the hotel (two miles ) from the airport and the same to the centre it is a standard charge by taxi ,however the hotel minibus takes you back for free all in all good base for exploring Rome with rootop views of the Vatican etc it was a great 5 day breakand we would go here again to be away from the hussle and bussle of the city as the connection to the metro works so well. We were warned of pickpockets and a lady from the hotel did get her purse take you have to be aware that,s all and perhaps keep wallets etc inside jackets but we were prepared before we went

Reviews.Title: “Just a word: OK!”
Reviews.Author: LisaeDario
Reviews.Content: Great hotel: well equipped, clean, good organised Great staff: very firnedly, really multilingual, always ready to help your requests Great rooms: clean, good dimension, good bathroom... even if the qir conditioning system could be too noisy during the night Great restaurant: even if the menu is not the wider I have seen, the food is good and the price is well placed. I have been there I think more than 40 night over 2010. Good qulity/price ratio if you book in advance by their site directly and if you stay more than 2 night. The pool is not big.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel average staff”
Reviews.Author: DambaKing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July, the hotel is fabulous but a lot leaves to be desired with the staff...they were unfriendly, not helpful and language barrier made it even hard. The Hotel itself is brilliant and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CHRYSAGREECE_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 looooooooong nights! Breakfast was poor but OK! Dinner was rubbish, we had to order pizza! My friends found a a black lace lady's underwear luing on their room floor, our shower was broken and we had to tell them again and again and again...when it was finally fixed it was time for us to go!!! The lady from Romania that served our dinner didn't know one single english word..so confusing! It was a disaster! And it was about 1,5 hour away from the centre of Rome, by bus!

Reviews.Title: “Business location”
Reviews.Author: Bersaglio
Reviews.Content: Location is definitely the main drawback of the hotel Capannelle: it is in fact situated quite far from everything, in a quiet, albeit green and pleasant, residential area not well connected with the city centre and its attractions. There is a free shuttle service to the closest metro station, but again it is not that convenient since the city centre is still a long metro ride away. Furthermore, around the hotel there's virtually nothing: just houses, no shops, restaurants, etc. Other than this, the hotel is a nice, regular business hotel with clean, comfortable rooms, good staff and a decent bar. The price is quite attractive, however if you do not have a car or the budget for a taxi (please bear in mind that the wait for a taxi might be long) I would suggest booking something in a more strategic location.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall, we would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: david_gracey
Reviews.Content: This is a large, modern hotel in a quiet residential area on the out-skirts of Rome. It seems to be trying to position itself as a Conference venue or a hotel for business travellers but there seemed to be many holiday makers like us amongst the guests. The shuttle bus to the metro has some strange running times but we used it on several occassions and found it reasonably convenient, certainly as far as getting to the City Centre was concerned. Coming back we were invariably tired and instead took a taxi from the City Centre (approximately €25). Just a quick word of warning, be careful with the Rome taxi drivers they will almost always offer a fixed price for your trip (i.e. not on the meter). If you do not want to pay double the correct price (at least) politely refuse and tell them you want the journey on the meter! Some will refuse in which case find another taxi - there is no shortage! The Rooms were exceptionally clean and very comfortable. The first night we had a problem with a strange intermitent bussing noise. Had we not have been completely knackered from driving 400km it would certainly have kept us awake. Next morning I was wondering how I could explain this strange noise to the receptionist, but when I started my description he immediately knew what I meant. In fact it was very clear that this is not the first time this fault had been reported in this Room. This really annoyed me - why did they allocate the Room when they knew of the problem? But anyway, we were allocated a new room and the rest of the stay was uneventful, in fact very pleasant. There is a limited choice of dinning in the local area. We tried the Italian restaurant recommended by the hotel (5 minutes walk). This seems to be popular with the locals. The young waiter seemed to be more interested in preening himself in front of my teenage daugther than actually serving food. He took our order without writing anything down......which would have been impressive if he had not forgotten several parts of the order! What did arrive was good, but not fantastic. There is a Cuban Restaurant, as mentioned in other reviews, just across from the hotel. I had a quick look around and it seemed a little shabby. In the end we settled for the hotel Restaurant. The food was OK but certainly a little overpriced. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It is not without its faults but I think the key statement is we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, only drawback was its location in the suburbs”
Reviews.Author: Lahr177
Reviews.Content: Friends chose this hotel as they were travelling with children, and I met up with them at the last minute. Normally I would have chosen a hotel closer to the city centre. The hotel itself was great: clean, modern, decent sized rooms, good A/C and TV in several different languages. There was a safe in each room. The pool area was amazing. A salt water pool (towel rental was 2 euros/day), place to sunbathe and a covered veranda with wicker (ish) furniture that made us feel like we were in the Caribbean. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel one night, the food was average. The food was much better at Girasolle restaurant around the corner (staff were happy to translate the menu for us) and the kids loved the strawberry/icecream/whip cream dessert. The only drawback was the hotel's location. It took at hour to get to the city centre. First we had to take a bus or the hotel shuttle (if there were seats - make sure you get in line at least 20 min before it is due to leave) to the Metro, then take the Metro downtown. It was fairly easy to navigate once we got the hang of it but did eat up a lot of time. You can take bus 664 or 26 from the Metro to the hotel, get off when you see the ruins on your right hand side and walk 5 min to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you have 4+ days in Rome. If you only have a few days and want to make the most of those few days, you are better off getting a hotel in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean, modern and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Fciocadan
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel although a bit far from the city centre unless you have a car. It's purpose built so its a lot nicer than some of the broom cupboards available in Rome. It was very handy to get private parking under the hotel at no extra charge. The Breakfast buffet was plentiful but very bland. The room was cleaned and tidied very well each day and there was plenty of fresh towels. Whilst the overall impression was impersonal it was a very comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent rates.”
Reviews.Author: kpjpx2
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter, & I stayed at this hotel five nights. We really liked the hotel. Pros: Free internet in room (not a single problem w/ internet. Small pool. Restaurant on site. Fairly large room, Air conditioned (I mention A/C because our hotel in Munich was not air conditioned.) Cons: Some staff unfriendly, but I found that if I was assertive, staff lightened up. Staff didn't volunteer information, but again, just be persistent with your questions. We didn't even try the shuttle bus at the hotel because of other reviews. We rented a car and drove to a recommended parking garage at train stop Cinecitta and took the train everywhere. Next time, I definitely will not rent a car. I will take a taxi from the hotel to train station. Except for Saturdays, the train stops running at 9pm. Ensure that you plan around this. Use the train, line A, for most sites, i.e.,Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. Take line B directly to the Coliseum and the Forum is directly across from the Colloseum. (If you take the train get off at stop Barberini for Trevi Fountain, stop Cipro for the Vatican, and line B stop Colosseo for the Colosseum & Forum.) Buy a Roma Pass at any of the tobacco shops. They all have a large T marking them. The pass costs 25 Euros, and you get in free to your first two sites (use it at the Coliseum and the Forum), and you can use the train and bus with the pass. The pass is good for three day after the first time you validate it. (This sounds confusing, but it's not, or I couldn't have figured it out!) The best thing about the Roma Pass is you can bypass the long lines!! This was great especially because the lines are in the very hot Rome sun. I recommend that you buy a travel guide. I bought Rick Steves' Italy 2011 from Amazon, and the tips/information in the book helped us tremendously. My overall recommendation is to not be shy....be courteous, &.ask questions. We found the Italians extemely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the hotel, although it is a little bit far from Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Inkietje
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty much ok, rooms are nice, breakfast is good. Also quite impressed with the service of the waiters in the restaurant. The hotel restaurant serves a good choice /variety of meals. The hotel shuttle bus is a joke, we stayed in the hotel for three nights and only managed to take the shuttle once; on our way back to the airport; have to say that we were there to queue up way in advance, like more than half an hour before the bus would leave.

Reviews.Title: “we love it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: teplc1
Reviews.Content: We are from Beijing, and we stay in this hotel for 4 weeks for business in Rome. the hotel is clean and room is large. the breakfast is good and the staff is nice. the location is in a suburb of middle -high class. We love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, should not be rated as a four star hotel. Unqualified staff.”
Reviews.Author: Marcia0482
Reviews.Content: I regret to say the service in this hotel is terrible. The staff are not friendly and do not go out of their way to assist you. I regret booking a hotel room for 9 days in this place. The hotel is, in theory, a 4 star hotel but they do not leave up to the four stars standard. Avoid staying in this hotel if you can.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotel I had ever stayed including USA”
Reviews.Author: elmisilbofill
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is supreme, it's a really nice modern hotel with all the facilities included. Location: This its the best hotel you can find if you arrive at Ciampino Airport because you have a free shuttle from the hotel to this airport round trip with a program schedule that you need to ask when you have your reservation. The hotel also have a free shuttles to the nearest metro station every 40 minutes,if you are able to follow the free shuttle schedule its going to be a perfect experience in Rome. I'm very happy to choose this hotel, that one was one of the best choice I had ever did. The hotel is outstanding and the room is supreme,with a bed even more bigger than our typical king size. The bathroom is amazing and the location of this hotel its very quite. You will find a nice restaurants and stores near this Hotel,you have actually a cuban restaurants just a few steps away from the lobby hotel and food its great and quality price equation are the best. Even if you get to Fuimicino this hotel remains at top of the best options available even if you have to pay a taxi to get here. Lets talk about breakfast, we dont have no words to describe the breakfast, the best breakfast I have ever had in my life,out of this world, and believe me when i say Italian coffee is the best coffee in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just sit straight on the sofas'....”
Reviews.Author: Henryhorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night en route for a cruise from the port at Civitivechia. Very nice modern hotel, pleasant view from the well equipped room overlooking quiet gardens with some traffic noise but bearable. The hotel was spotlessly clean and had a bar where you could buy meals as well as a restaurant. The shuttle bus collects from the airport or takes you to the station (we didn't use it preferring a local taxi) but saw many people travelling that method. There was a pool but it was closed though no signs to say that, we saw one couple being told to get out which didn't thril them.. I'm not sure why but the security guard was pacing back and forth staring at people, at one point my husband picked up a leaflet and perched on the arm of the very substantial leather settee to show me it, within 5 seconds the guard was there and in an unfriendly manner told him to get off the arm at once and sit properly! We were so shocked neither of us said a thing, but really, it was no way to treat customers... Both of us have stayed in many hotels but never experienced being made to feel about 10 years of age and in trouble! So my main review is pleasant hotel, well situated if you don't want the noise and heat of central Rome, handy for the airport and faultless except for the overbearing manner of some staff.. (I managed to sneak a photo of the chap in question, hopefully it will be with this review)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Chessiered
Reviews.Content: Quiet, residential location. Large, clean hotel. On the whole we found the staff to be friendly and helpful particularly the housekeeping and bar staff. Reception could be a little unhelpful as though they had better things to do with their time.. This is essentially a business hotel, there is little information available to the foreign tourist as to how to get about etc. The rooms are lovely and clean, we found the mattresss to be extremely hard. The bathrooms were lovely, nice deep baths, good shower! There are no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. You cannot open the windows and housekeeping have to come and open them for you as well as come back to lock them which is a bit of a pain. Breakfast was good, there was a good selection of foods. There was free, secure parking at the hotel which is why we chose this hotel. It is perfectly located for the motorway to explore Tuscany - we drove to Firenze and the journey was very straight forward. It was not too far away from the centre of Rome - you couldnt pop back during the day but it wasnt so far as to be worth spending alot more money to stay in the centre. We enjoyed the opportunity to escape the madness of central Rome back to the quiet serenity of this hotel. The pool area is also lovely and a great place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Rome, if a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: UglyKlown
Reviews.Content: Well my wife and I decided that Rome would be the first trip away without our two year old son. What a lovely city, if expensive. We decided to stretch our finances by staying at the Capannelle. Well first off the hotel offer a free bus from Ciampiano airport to the hotel. Please email before and request a timetable to ensure your flight landing time fits this. The only true alternative is a taxi, which is a flat 30 Euro fee. Unfortunately I learnt this lesson the hard way. The shuttle bus becomes a Godsend. It also drops you and collects you from two of the Metro stations (Arco di Travertino and Cinecittà). Beware the metro does close Sunday to Friday at 9pm. So again taxi's after that. Once at the hotel, which isn't in the most attractive of places, having said that it's not that bad, the hotel it's self is lovely. It's mainly a very clean, Marble palace. The receptionists are extremely friendly and helpful and there are usually a bellhop around if you need. it. Rooms are not available until 2pm, we arrived early, but they have a secure locked room to leave your cases. The rooms are clean, with extremely large (I'd say super king) sized beds. They are a bit hard for my liking, but everyone's different. The room had a lovely shower/bath all clad in marble, a mini bar, wardrobe, tub chair and dressing table with a flat screen TV showing different language satellite TV channels, along with the usual pay per view movies and adult entertainment and films. They are a bit steep at 10 Euro a viewing so beware. The English channels are quite poor especially as both Eurosport and MTV are meant to be English but were not. There is a restaurant with an executive chef, but we did not use this so cannot comment. We did however use the complimentary breakfast. It's down a level (level -1 in the lift). It's the usual continental meats, cheese and rolls. Toast, cereals, fruit and Yoghurt's. Also streaky bacon and smoked sausages. Also a large selection of home-made cakes and doughnuts. There is endless tea/coffee/cappuccinos/water/fruit juices. Overall it filled a gap and was definitely plentiful. It's nothing to write home about. Overall I would recommend this hotel, providing you are OK with the location. The people were great, the hotel clean and provided a very pleasant base for our trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: catalin_37
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our staying here, very nice and polite employees. We also enjoyed the breakfast, good quality and very fast service. The shuttle is a ingenious way to compensate the distance between hotel and historic center of Rome. We have a very nice opinion of our vacation in Rome and Hotel Capannelle is one of the reasons. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep (bed), spacious room, very safe area, no wow-factor.”
Reviews.Author: Chinhealer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Ciampino Airport with an inkling that there is a free shuttle bus to Hotel Capannelle. We asked a few of the friendly, young, Italian, behoodied tour-operator/guide types hanging around various bus shelters there where it would pick us up. We were pointed towards shelter 3, but none of them seemed to know exactly when. We waited for about half an hour in the draining afternoon sunshine before deciding to take a taxi. We paid 36 Euros for the privilege, but we later learned that we would have had to wait till around 6.50pm for the next free shuttle bus. So unless you happen to find yourself at the bus stop at 7am, 9am, 11am or 6.50pm (Mon-Fri) or 7.10am, 8.10am, 9.10am, 12.50pm or 7.50pm (Sat-Sun-Bank Holidays) a taxi is your best bet. These are the current bus times in April 2011, but of course you should check out the latest times when you travel. We also found the shuttle bus to be incredibly useful (and money-saving!) on each day of our short trip to get into central Rome for all the sites. The bus would leave at various times during the day from the hotel and, in less than 15minutes usually, drop us off at either Cinecitta or Arco di Travertino Metro station. From there, it was a quick and easy and hassle-free ride to wherever we fancied in Rome. At the end of our sightseeing day, we would head back to one of the aforementioned Metro stations at one of the designated times and be taken back to Hotel Capannelle. The system is a good one. Essential, in fact, considering how far the hotel is from all the major tourist attractions! The alternative would have been spending nigh-on 90-100 Euros a day just for taxis! We did find a few glitches with the system, however. For a start, it is essential that you arrive at least 20 mins before the designated time as the bus drivers have a habit of arriving a few minutes early at the stop, hovering up any waiting hotel guests and immediately leaving for the hotel! Anyone arriving on time is liable to see the back end of the bus trundling off into the distance! The other thing to consider is that that although the bus service continues through the night until 12.15am, the entire Metro system is currently shutting down at 9pm owing to some building works. I understand that there are replacement bus services available after 9pm, but journey times are bound to be much longer and more difficult than the Metro itself. We were happy to return to Capannelle on the 6.30pm bus from Cinecitta or, at the latest, on the 8.30pm bus from Arco di Travertino after long hours traipsing around Rome. But we never got to see Rome by night or enjoy any of Rome’s night-time entertainments. If you don’t come truly alive until darkness falls, Capannelle is probably not best placed for your needs. But for those wanting a comfortable (if not exactly swanky) four-star hotel in an incredibly quiet and safe upmarket residential neighbourhood, Capannelle is ideal. We heard absolutely no noise from outside and practically zero noise from within the hotel. That, coupled with an extremely comfortable (ie. comfortably hard and sturdy and spacious) bed meant that we slept better at Capannelle than we have in practically every other hotel room we’ve ever been in! The room itself was very clean, with tasteful, if not exactly opulent, décor and was a very decent size indeed. (Think just slightly smaller than the biggest family rooms available at Premier Inns in the UK.) On the other hand, we weren’t exactly impressed with the bathroom. The plughole was almost blocked for the first night, the toilet was idiotically positioned too close to the counter area which meant that anyone with shoulders wider than Olive Oyl had an uncomfortable time on the throne and the water pressure in the shower was merely satisfactory at best. Oh, and because the shower-screen was one of those that only covers a third of the length of the bath, unless we positioned the shower head almost directly over the plughole, the rest of the bathroom got intolerably wet every time anyone had a shower! Attention to detail was definitely lacking in Capannelle overall. The breakfast was decent, if typical, European fare – scrambled eggs, roast potatoes, cheeses, cold cuts, yoghurts, juices, hot drinks from a machine, cereals, fruits, toast, a good selection of cakes and croissants and pastries and a mutant-sized jar of Nutella! Certainly enough to fuel you up for the day ahead. The service at the front desk was variable. (Varying from bordering-on-the-impatient to the genuinely warm and helpful. Ileniya – apologies if I misspelled her name – was particularly accommodating and friendly.) One of the attractions of Capannelle for me was the presence of an outdoor swimming pool. And it is certainly set in a lovely little outdoor area. Unfortunately, the pool was closed during our stay. But I can imagine it being just splendid in the height of summer. It being a residential area, there is absolutely zilch to see and do within walking distance of the hotel. There is a sub-prime supermarket (Todis) down the road (which out-Lidls Lidl!!) which is pleasingly cheap and perfect for water and snacks and fruit and toiletries and etc. There is a beautiful-looking restaurant a short walk beyond Todis (adjacent to the busy Via Appio Nova) called Gira Solo. The food was quite acceptable for us (we’re vegetarian) and was a good default option on the days when we didn’t have time to eat in central Rome without missing our last bus back to the hotel. Also, the staff were very welcoming and at least two of them spoke excellent English. (And the other lady who didn’t speak English very well understood my incompetent Italian sufficiently!) To summarize, I’d say that if peace and a good night’s rest in a safe area are high priorities for you, Hotel Capannelle is perfect. If true luxury, proximity to central Rome or a yearning to indulge in Rome’s nightlife are important to you, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but wouldn't choose for a Rome holiday”
Reviews.Author: JBerkeley73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a residential area, located roughly between Ciampino airport (10 min) and Cinecitta metro station (10 min). The free hotel shuttle operates only a few times every day. Taxi and public bus are an option. Also note however that the metro is currently only operating until 9PM. Pro: friendly service, clean, close to airport, generous room size, ample parking if required Con: only basic comfort, distant from centre, average breakfast, little to see or do in the immediate neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, good services, perfect transportation by hotel shuttlebus.”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Tkacik
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, good services, perfect transportation by hotel shuttlebus. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MariliaBrito
Reviews.Content: I could not imagine how good this hotel was when I made my reservation. The room was very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff was always available to help. Breakfast was the best one I ever had in Europe. Garage was safe. If you go to Rome by car, I would say this is the best option for you to stay, rest and get lost in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest disappointment was that we could not stay an extra night!”
Reviews.Author: tomothy88
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to Rome for his birthday and after searching through hundreds of hotels, Hotel Capannelle was by far the best hotel for the price. The fact that it offers a free shuttle bus to and from Ciampino Airport and to and from the metro stations is what inevitably swung it for us and when we arrived, the hotel did not disappoint. Set in a very quiet suburban area about 15 minutes away from Ciampino Aiport, the hotel is modern, bright, spacious and had a hint of luxury to it. The staff are very pleasant, smart and friendly. We stayed in a classic double room and to be honest, we didn't really need anything more than that. The room was bright with huge windows, beautifully decorated and the bed was massive. The bathroom was modern and very very clean. Breakfast was not at all bad either. The usual selection of pastries, bacon, scrambled egg etc... nice selection of teas and cereals, nothing fancy, but nothing scrimped either. We did not eat at the restaurant in the evening as we were out late on both nights, but my partner did have a peek in and said the food looked as if it had come from a 5* restaurant. The hotel's shuttle bus was so convenient too. With plenty of times running to two metro stations (Arco di Travertino and Cinecitta), we had no problems getting to and from the centre of Rome.The metro ride in to Termini took about 20 minutes and cost a euro and there we transferred across to the B line and got off at Colosseo. It literally took no more than 30 minutes to get from our room to the Colosseum. The only big disappointment was that we could not stay an extra night as the hotel was fully booked! We had only booked a one way ticket and alas! there were no returning flights on the Monday. Our options were to stay another night at the hotel or fly from Fiumicino Airport back to London Gatwick which would have meant a long journey back to Cardiff. The friendly staff at the hotel did try to help us as much as they could, but we decided to fly from Fiumicino rather than stay in another hotel. Without a moments hesitation, this is the hotel we will come back to time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kxxxk
Reviews.Content: It is a good business hotel but it is not a good idea to book there if it is your first time in Rome. It is far about 40 minutes to the centre (stazione Termini). You can get a shuttle bus from Arco di travertino or Cinecittà but ask at the reception the schedule time. The driver is great! I liked the business centre well run and the restaurant. The buffet breakfast was good with home made cake, croissant, scrambled eggs, bacon, etc. The coffee and cappuccino and juices were done with the vending machines - awful! The room was very clean in the first 3 days. the last night they replaced only the towels and made the bed without changing the sheets: that was all. You could hear all the noises in the hallway during the night. No noise from the outside. The reception staff was professional but unfriendly. I recommend it for a meeting or a conference. Not for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “awful..”
Reviews.Author: savvas189449
Reviews.Content: we arrived from prague and we stayed for one night in this hotel only cause it was near ciampino airport.we were arranged a transfer at the cost of 50 euros from fiumicino AIRPORT.our flight was late we rang them and we inform them that.they told us befole arriving to call.as we did.as we arrived in the airport there was nobody.we phoned they said wait a little bit and after 2 hours a driver came and told us the car was broken.no one sorry.we felt like animals.after 1 hour we went in the reception we told them that and they told other story that the driver ws sitting in the airport in the parking place and waited for us.something totally different.we paied 50 euros for nothing no one sorry they said.they tried to convince us that is our fault.after that they gave us a awful room that smellt cigarette and we are both non smokers.we asked what they gonna do for this and they said to give us 2 glass of wine.i refused it ofcourse.in 2010 i think this kind of bussiness they dont have place.the restayrant is very good and the breaKFAST.avoid this hotel is not worth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Far From the Action in Rome”
Reviews.Author: tmblweed
Reviews.Content: The lobby is small but neat. Theres a quaint souvenir shop opposite the front desk. The items are obviously overpriced as compared to your options at the Trevi Fountain area but its still a good place to pick up last minute gifts for family/friends. Absolutely loved my room! The doorlocks were electronic. I was slightly grounded when touching the doorknob once, but I didn't care. The room was spacious, clean, and smelled nice. The bathroom was large, well lit and very clean. The closet has ample space and is very clean. The bed is large and very comfortable. Although the frontdesk clerks were pleasant and charming, some members of the staff were arrogant and haughty in dealing with members of our group. Breakfast was odd. The dining room was sectioned off and food selections were different for each. We were served the saltiest scrambled egg ever! The location of the hotel is far removed from the central district. It seemed like we were living in the suburbs amidst residential apartments. Although we escaped the noise of the city, we had to brave the traffic for an hour before we reached any of the tourist spots. We couldnt savor the city late into the night since we had a long drive through dreadful roman traffic back to the hotel. Nevertheless, the hotel rooms are still superb and they offered great comfort and respite after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghoul101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was Awesome!! Great friendly staff who are always willing to help you. Can recommend it to any one staying in Italy. The bedrooms are neat and tidy as well as large. The buffet breakfast is really awesome with a wonderful assortments of goodies to eat. My wife is still raving over the hotel!! Anton Wells

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Capanelle”
Reviews.Author: Christoph911
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, clean, modern with all the amenities. You can get from your room to Termini station in the heart of Rome in 30 minutes. CAN is the operative word. The shuttle service takes you to Cinecitta metro station. (Wait for the shuttle directly under the light brown Cinecitta sign at the metro exit.There is only one Cinecitta) For the 08h00 and 17h00 shuttle service the shuttle takes in a trip of other stops (none tourist related) that makes your trip to Rome more like 80 or 90 minutes. AVOID these shuttle times. Some trips also pass by the airport, which also adds time to your journey. If the shuttle runs smoothly there is no problem with this hotel, on the contrary it is a great deal. Bus 654 passes 50 steps from the front door, so there is an alternative to the shuttle from Cinecitta. Beware that the trip from Cinecitta to the hotel by City Bus leaves from the stop OPPOSITE the Cinecitta at a small, very poorly marked stop. It is hand written on a steel pole next to the other bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Super price, service, hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennis347
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and it's a gem! The staff was very helpful, the room was spacious, clean & reasonably priced and the shuttle to/from CIA airport and the Metro was a bonus. If the shuttle time doesn't fit your schedule, walk 1 block to the bus stop (#654) for the short trip to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: HerliS81
Reviews.Content: Just got back today after a 5 night stay at the hotel with my Partner. After searching and reviewing hotels across all areas of Rome, we decided on the Capanelle. The hotel seemed to have great reviews, good value for money and good facilities. After our visit I can agree with this totally. A few days before our trip I emailed the hotel regarding the free shuttle service they offer and was emailed back the very next day with the timetable and advised that the bus would be slightly to the left, outside the airport lounge on our arrival. This was exactly the case. The yellow hotel capanelle bus was there waiting for us. It is approximately a 20 minute drive from the airport to hotel and although when driving to the hotel it would appear that a lot of the buildings nearby are run down, after a short while in Rome you will realise that this is not so bad an area and that in actual fact, most of Rome does look run down! As we arrived at the hotel a couple of hours before check in time, our luggage was placed inside for us. Reception staff are polite and welcoming. We then walked up the road to the left of the hotel. Here there is a Todis supermarket. It is really cheap in there and I would recommend this for things such as water, fruit, any snacks and the lovely bakery counter in there. Also if you take a left from the hotel and then a left again, at the bottom of that road you will find a few more shops and a market there on a friday. When we were allowed into the room we found it to be spacious, clean, huge bed, safe inside wardrobe (free), fridge with mini bar, hair dryer in bathroom, nice big window, bathroom spotlessly clean. The only grumble I would have was that there was only one pillow each on the bed. There is a note on the fridge stating that you can not put your own food or drink in there and that if you do it will be removed. We frequently bought drinks and some food which we placed in there and this was never removed. The hotel pool was clean and quiet. Plenty of sun loungers. Soft music playing around outside. There are leather beanbags and tables outside. Really beautiful of a night also. Although we travelled there in October and were unsure whether to take swim suits, we found that that weather was glorious. We both got a little burnt from spending a much needed one day out of the five in Rome, lying next to the hotel pool. I really think I could not have coped in July/August time weather walking around so many sites for days. On the website it states there is a roof terrace but upon venturing up there we found nothing at all. No tables or chairs which was a shame as there are nice views. Breakfast in the hotel is 7-10am. I would say breakfast is good. Plenty of fruit juice, water, coffee, tea for drinks. Then to eat there are fruit, range of cereals, lots of sweet breads and croissants (which to me are not for breakfast time but the Italians seem to love it!), cheese, cold meats, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, sausage (hotdog style) and bacon (not like english bacon). Better than I expected really and no charge for fruit juice as some reviews state. Besides breakfast we never ate at the hotel. They do a lunch buffet salad for 8 euros which looked pretty pathetic but of an evening they do pasta specials for 10 euros which seemed quite nice. A large beer (heineken) was 5 euros and they have a selection of cocktails for approximately 7 euros. Hotel shuttle runs quite regularly. Romans drive like lunatics and this mixed with bumpy roads means you are likely to bounce around the bus quite a bit especially if sitting at the back. The hotel reception have timetables they will give you detailing drop off and pick up times. We found this really useful. I would warn you that there are not many seats on the shuttle and so get there promptly. We did see people being turned away as the shuttle was full, although as there seems to be tons of public buses around, I dont think this would be much of a problem if this was to happen. The shuttle will drop you off at Cinnecitta metro station. From here you can get a pass for 1, 3 or 7 days that will allow you to travel on any public transport in Rome (Metro, Tram, Bus). As we were there 5 days we opted for the 7 day pass and this cost 16 euros each. I cant emphasise how great value for money this was. Probably the best bargain of our whole trip. Each time you enter a Metro station you will need to enter the ticket into a machine to gain entry. The Metro consists of 2 lines (A&B) which although guide books will tell you is not very useful, we found to be great. We found most major sites such as the Vatican, Colloseum, Forum, Trevi Fountain to be a few minutes (if that) away from metro stops.
