The metro gets really busy, especially early morning or late at night. You will have people squashed up against you and often find an arm pit in your face! Just be careful with your handbag. Do like the roman ladies do and wear your bag across your chest! Last Metro is at 11.30pm from the Termini and this will get you back to Cinnecitta station in plenty of time for the last hotel shuttle pick up at 12.15. I would say that the Capannelle is a great base camp which is great value for money. The hotel is pleasant, bright and clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Obviously you could stay closer to the City Centre and attractions but this would be at least double the cost and besides this, City Centre hotels would not of had the facilities such as the lovely outdoor pool which if you are there for a few days, is nice to just relax by after a hard days walking. If you dont mind the idea of 10 mins hotel shuttle travel and then travelling on the Metro for approximately 25 mins to Termini each time you want to get into or out of the City of Rome, then I would say that this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: steph2shoes
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews on TA we decided to stay at the hotel for our 3 night break in "Rome".... we were disappointed!! This hotel is fine as a conference centre but not as a base for sightseeing in Rome. It's too far out from the city centre!! The travel time into Rome including waiting time for the shuttle bus/public transport takes between 45mins to 1 hour. Which means a big chunk of the day could be taken up with commuting (3 - 4 hours). That's assuming, like us, you go into Rome do some sightseeing, then go back to hotel and freshen up before returning to Rome again for the evening. Which makes a total of 4 journeys each day..... it was exhausting!!! We came back from our holiday completely shattered. Also the shuttle bus times were pretty inconvenient. Ask the hotel for a shuttle bus timetable before booking. That's if reception can be bothered to reply. We found some of the receptionists to be very unhelpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Daily commute was a hassle!!”
Reviews.Author: mikealina
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay at the hotel. To anyone considering staying at the Capannelle, please be aware it is located quite some distance from the centre of Rome. Unlike some TA reviewers, we found the commute into Rome and back to the hotel more hassle and more stressful than we imagined it would be. For instance, standing on a jam packed train for up to 45 minutes is not pleasant and can be very tiring. Particularly after a long day sight-seeing in Rome. The shuttle bus service operated by hotel, which takes you to a couple of local metro stations was usually very punctual. However, for some reason there's a big gap in the afternoon service of 3 hours when the bus isn't available, either from hotel or as pick-up from metro. Also there's only one early evening bus, at 18:15, with the next leaving at 20:15. Apart from that, overall the hotel was fine. However, we did have some niggles with the plumbing and air-conditioning. The water pressure from the shower was pretty poor, particularly first thing in morning when everyone else in the hotel seemed to be taking a shower at the same time. Then the water barely trickled out of the shower head. Also we just could not get the aircon to work properly, we either froze or baked during the night, which made for a pretty uncomfortable nights sleep!! If we ever visit Rome again we will pay the extra and stay in the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful rome and capannelle hotel”
Reviews.Author: PISCESCo_Down
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel. Definitely 4*. Beautifully decorated ,large ,quiet rooms, modern bathroom , good breakfast and friendly staff. Swiimming pool also. This hotel is on the outskirts of Rome. From Fiumicino airport take the local train to Tuscolana train station. It costs 8 euros.Walk for 5 minutes to Ponte Lungo metro and take line A to Capannelle metro. Outside the metro wait in the lay-by for bus number 653 which takes you near the hotel. The hotel has a shuttle bus which we used daily. In Rome buy the Roma pass which costs 25 euros. It allows unlimited travel for 3 days and free entry to the first 2 museums of your choice. We by- passed a massive queue at the Colosseum using this pass. Rome is the most exciting city I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous Place!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyRef7
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of the reviews that I saw on the website, but I got better than I ever expected. The staff was knowable and extremely helpful. The room was clean, bright when I needed and dark if I needed that also. I was so impressed I took pictures so that I could show my family and friends. I will always stay at this Hotel when I visit Rome. It was close to the Metro, which was easy to jump on and off at all the places I wanted to visit. Loved, Loved, Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base to explore Rome. Stunning hotel. Plus a pool!!”
Reviews.Author: blinky182er
Reviews.Content: I my girlfriend and I went to this hotel last year and had a bliss experience. It was booked via Expedia, and with a bus transfer to and from the airport it cost around £325 for a week, bed and breakfast. We decided early on that our holiday was going to be split around 50-50, exploring Rome and relaxing by the pool. This worked out well, we saw a lot of Rome on our days out. However, after a days walking, in often 35+ degrees heat, you need a day off. As I mentioned in the title, this place is the perfect base to get into Rome. Its so easy, just speak to the hotel staff, they will tell the exact numbers of buses and trains to get. It only took aprox. 30 mins to get into central Rome. The hotel itself. Hopefully you won't be spending too much time here because Rome is out there, and there is a lot to see. But what time is spent here is very peaceful and tranquil, especially if you can fluke a sun bed by the pool. Yes the pool is small, but lets be honest, your wasting your time and money if you come here to lie by a pool all day. The hotel breakfast is good, just what you need for a hot day ahead of you. As for lunch and evening meals, I can't tell you. It looked expensive, always is. For food, lunch in particular, there is a supermarket just down the road called 'Todis'. Get a roll, some ham, tomato, parmesan, and save 10 euros a day. Which, as my partner and I were only 19 at the time suited us down to the ground on our budget. For dinner, I would recommend 'Lou's Place'. This tiny restaurant, situated on the main road, heading left from the exit of the hotel, is by far the best. You will pass a number of fancy restaurants on the main road, expensive, and poor. This family run, authentic Italian is what you need. It may not look the prettiest but it is by far the cheapest and most delicious. In Rome though, one place I can recommend to eat is called 'Antica Birreria Peroni'. Families, teenagers, couples, handsome business men. Everyone came to this place to enjoy a traditional, cosmopolitan Italian supper. Know one speaks English, everyone has a great time and a real laugh. Probably the best restaurant experience I have EVER had. Bottom line is, this hotel is affordable, classy, spacious and has the largest most comfortable bed which is essential after a straining day in the sun. Don't pay truck loads for anything else. Would not even consider another hotel if I was going back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Haven from the Gorgeous chaos that is Downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: matty-os
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 4 nights and 3 days, I had researched the hotel and appreciated it was fairly far from central rome however the hotel has an extremely efficient and prompt and FREE shuttle that makes around 20 journys to the hotel and 20 journys from various metro stations. from 630am to midnight in a marked bus which is hard to miss. Do not be worried about spending time travelling. even in rush hour its 15 mins on the hotel shuttle (one leaves at the convineient time of 945am to Arco di travertino) and then around 12 mins to termini on metro line A. If you can tolerate this minor travel then you will be rewarded with a huge hotel, huge bedrooms (twice the size of ibis rooms). The breakfast was above average serving scrambled eggs, potatoes home made cakes, pastries, bread and cereal. breakfast is served till 10am which is excellent if you arrive late at the hotel, the last shuttle was just after midnight. The hotel is huge and the resturant served wonderful food, around 10-15€ for a main and around 8€ for a sweet. The prices are similar to those restuarants in centro storico etc so i wouldnt say the restaurant was overpriced in comparison to its competition. The bus 654 leaves from around the corner from the hotel and makes around 5 departures per day. We used this bus to travel from cincecitta metro to the hotel. The hotel is located in a quiet suberb with a supermarket and a cuban restaurant around 2 minutes walk. I was angered by some of the comments regarding the location of the hotel. It makes me question do people research a hotel before booking it?? granted the hotel does not have central location but it does not claim to. it was nice to come to a peacefull location after a busy day and 30 minutes to get to central rome is well worth it. if this hotel was in central rome it would cost at least £300 per night and was easily the nicest place i have stayed in. The hotel had a safe great air con and our room had a balcony, however you must ask the bell boy to open the door and then call them when u want it closed (we did not request this) Upon checking in you will be given a free timetable and i would advise a guest to plan there day around the shuttle departures. I did download a shuttle timetable however the timtable hande to me by the receptionist containe double the amount of departures.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: KjSandford
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we required from our trip to Rome, the staff were friendly and spoke very good English, we had no problems with the room which was spacious and cleaned every morning with a new set of towels. You do have to ring down to reception to get the balcony opened which is a little inconveniant but they are always fast to respond to your request Breakfast was always top notch, with everything being stocked up throughout the morning and there was always enough to keep you going, a small hot selection, toast, coffee, tea, cereal, cold meats and cheeses and continental pastries. The pool is small, big enough if you just want to cool off, not big enough if you want to do olympic lengths every morning! The location is a bit outside of Rome, but the free shuttle service is prompt and efficient, the underground is cheap and there are bus routes if you miss the shuttle (which we did once!). We spent 2 days in Rome doing the compulsory sightseeing and then spent the rest of the holiday around the pool relaxing. We never ate dinner in the hotel restaurant because there is the most amazing traditional Italian restaurant about 10 mins walk away. The staff there are very helpful, laid back, speak very good English and try to make your meal a good experience, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough! In the near vicinity there is also a small supermarket (good for stocking up on water, which you then keep in the fridge in your room!), a selection of deli's (good for a sandwich for lunch if you dont want to pay the inflated prices in the hotel), and a couple of bars where you can get a lovely cup of coffee throughout the day, or a drink at night. This hotel is awesome if you want a base for getting into and out of Rome without paying through the nose. The pool area is perfect for building a tan and the surrounding area contains enough amenities to survive on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice outskirts of Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: jlobster
Reviews.Content: We have won six days in this hotel thanks to the prize assigned by the bank for the verse about it. We stayed in Bologna one day and then moved to Rome by rail. The Hotel Domina is on the south from the centre. It has a pool, nice breakfast buffet, fine rooms with computers with Internet connection (for the money) , and powerful conditioning systems. But, unfortunately, the condiioning could work only if the digital key-card is inside the room, so when we returned from city, it was rather hot there during first five minutes. The pool is good. There are museum just near the hotel - ruins of some villa. But to reach the main attractions everyone has to use hotel shuttle bus to the nearest metro station or city bus. In all, his trip takes more than half an hour, and it is problem to return back by municipal transport after 23-30PM, only taxi can help in this case

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, shame about the locals”
Reviews.Author: jesoid
Reviews.Content: Firstly this hotel is on the outskirts of Rome, a shuttle bus is provided or the local transport is easily available and adds to the all round experience..take the 654 bus from the right of the hotel to the metro station, from there everything can be reached. The hotel is fairly new and very clean, the roof terrace is a must at night and offers fantastic views. The staff are helpful but don't expect any small talk, breakfast is the same every day but plentiful,fill up and you won't have to spend much on food during the day. The rooms were fine but we would have liked more information on how to use things..ie safe,aircon etc. Regarding the city..we prebooked a Vatican tour on their official website to avoid queues,on the day we were to visit Rome decided to have a transport strike ;(... we were able to share a taxi with a fellow guest which cost €40...I would strongly recommend anyone use a taxi if you get off on thrill seeking,they are all nutters! My only complaint about this great city is the Italian customer service..its non-existent in most places, it would appear they treat tourists as a nuisance.I thought learning some Italian would help but they claimed not to understand anyway. Our worst episode was actually inside the Vatican, we queued to buy some goods and the woman actually ignored us and walked off to wipe a stain from her shirt.I walked up to her holding out the goods and she still ignored me, saying Scussi seemed to bring a look that would kill if she could..we handed the items over and paid and not a word passed her lips,considering the place in which she worked I would have hoped for better. If you go to Rome with the acceptance that the inhabitants are ignorant then you will have a great time,if this attitude bothers you then stay home. Must sees are the vatican,(excellent value for money),colloseum (don't get badgered into a tour by countless touts,just queue and wait),Trevi fountain (outstanding). When we were there the temperature hit 40 degrees..take a bottle of water with you and keep it, there are plenty of drinking fountains around Rome where you can refill your bottle.The water is straight from the Spa and ice cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - shame about the transfers!”
Reviews.Author: madgehassan666
Reviews.Content: The domina hotel was a lovely, clean hotel with most of the staff being friendly and welcoming, although they didn't talk too much and kept themselves to themselves. The rooms are clean and spacious and the bathrooms are lovely too. The maids are very good and kept the hotel spotless, and the breakfast we had each morning was lovely and the endless cups of coffee you could help yourself to were helpful when we were traipsing through Rome all day! The breakfast offered a buffet type selection with cereals, toast and cakes, fruit, cheeses and meats etc and coffee, teas, fruit juices all of which you could have as much as you liked. The hotel served dinner which you could pay for if you werent all enclusive however the menu was a little expensive and quite the gastronomique style which we're not really fans of! The bar is nice and the staff gave us lots of snacks and bruscetta free with our drinks! The shuttle bus to the train stations provided by the hotel is very punctual and although the driver is a little moody we were grateful as we used this everyday and spent almost our whole holiday in rome. The staff at reception are very helpful and will give you rail maps and tell you where you need to get off for all the different sights. A 24hr rail ticket costs 4 euros which is amazing considering you can get on and off as much as you want. But honestly if you like a good stroll you could walk to each sight as Rome itself isn't that huge. A bit smaller than central london. THE ONLY BAD THING TO SAY ABOUT THE WHOLE HOLIDAY IS THE DRIVING!!!!! The italians drive very differently to every other country I've ever seen. Be careful when crossing the roads as they often drive through red lights!! The only time we saw cars stop to let people cross was at the vatican when nuns and priests were crossing! Needless to say you can use this to your advantage!!!! Our transfers were very scary as both vehicles were falling apart, one without any seatbelts.. and the moody drivers were even cheeky enough to hang around for a tip after!! Also be careful of pickpockets and people trying to con you for tat!! It's basically the same as london but in a different language. So if you can handle yourself there you will be fine!! Happy Holidays!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel for the money.”
Reviews.Author: d0sser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of February/beginning March 2010. The staff service was very good. The reception desk arranged a pre-booked third bed in the room within the hour. The included breakfast buffet was plentiful,and replenished right up until advertised closing time. The room was clean,and well appointed. The local area is a pleasant residential one,and there are quite a few restaurants and bars. When the free shuttle bus to the metro was full,there were frequent local buses from the same street as the hotel. Get an all inclusive travel ticket from atac.roma. All night buses from Rome centre run to within walking distance. Overall,a very pleasant week's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony Issues,”
Reviews.Author: skydiver028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently, and found the staff to be friendly and helpful. There may have been on surly one, but most were great. The breakfasts were generous, but predictable, more variety would have been better, but reasonable quality. The rooms were a good size and well equpped, the only issue I have is with the balcony,. I paid extra for a balcony, but everytime I wanted to open it I had to call reception to open/ close it, which became a bit of a chore. Also they are not what you would expect from a balcony, there is no segregation between them, so no privacy and no furniture, so not so much a balcony as a space outside your french windows! The hotel was modern, but felt unfinished. An underutilised roof terrace, provides a view but nothing else. The pool was clean and there were plenty of sunbeds. The hotel even provides the towel! In terms of location, it is a little way from Rome, but there are shops and restuarants/bars within walking distance, you just have to use your imagination to find them. A supermarket literally 100 metres away and a Cuban restaurant just metres from the front door. meals in the hotel are a little pricey but quite edible, not 5star, but adequate. Bar drinks are very pricy!! All in all a good stay, well rested, quiet rooms and comfortable beds. I would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: aranay
Reviews.Content: Good points: - The hotel provides a free shuttle to the subway every half an hour in the mornings and in the evenings up until midnight. - Parking is €10 per night - Internet €3 per hour, €5 per 3 hours - Breakfast is a buffet with a good choice - Ask at the reception the free Rome map, and they can also tell you about the best sightseeing places in Rome - Hotel is new and clean, all furniture is brand new Bad points: - we were given a room that was separated by the locked door from another room, therefore we could hear quite a lot from what was happening in the room next to ours. - The hotel is not in the center. It takes about 40 minutes from the hotel to the center of Rome: 15 minutes by bus shuttle, and around 25 minutes by subway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a bit far from city center”
Reviews.Author: Caramelle
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at Domina and we appreciated this hotel. The room (executive) was large enough, very clean and comfortable. The staff was helpfull and the breakfast is varied. We never waited for a table and the buffet was filled frequently. The hotel restaurant is good and there are other good restaurants in the area (try Girasole with their huge terrace). There is a discount supermarket (Todis) if you need food, water or other stuff. There is also a laundry service and a post office on the same street. We took bus #654 to subway station (Colli Albani) to reach the city center. It takes about 45min. From Fiumicino Airport, you can take a train to Tuscolana station (8 Euros), then walk to the subway station (Ponte Lungo), then stop at Colli Albani station (Line A) to take bus #654 (stop at Appio Claudio) and the hotel is 5 minutes from there. You can use subway and bus with the same ticket (1 Euro). The view from the hotel roof is great. Swimming pool opens in June and there is an outdoor area to relax and have a drink. I would recommend this hotel if you stay more than 3 days in Rome because it is far from the city center and you're gonna lose time in transportation. Also, don't use Internet from the TV screen, it does not work properly (there is a problem with the screen resolution). It is better from to use it from a laptop. Moreover, if you want to go onto your balcony, you must call someone at the front desk to open the door and someone to close it as well...

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: CrazyWookie
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at Domina for four nights during first week of June. Never been to Rome before but booked by wifey as we've always wanted to go. Hotel was great, very clean. We upgraded on the room so don't know what standard room was like, but there was marble and wood everywhere. Things I would've liked was tea/coffee facilities in room, which they don't do, a shower with more power and only the bathroom had the mirror. There's also no iron/board provided to guests so you'd have to pay for clothes to be ironed if needed. I read on another review that you have to pay for TV - you do but there are 3 news channels to watch for free. But you'll spend all day out so we didn't care. It's like a 4-5* when you get in, but just misses a few things. Staff were very good, friendly and helpful. We checked in at 12 instead of quoted 2pm time without any probs. Breakfast comprised of bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs only for cooked. Didn't go near the bacon or sausages, eggs were okish. Also cereals, breads, cakes, yogurts, fruits as well as coffees and juices. Wasn't great but I'm quite fussy on food so others may think it's very good. Not complaining though because we filled ourselves up for the morning! Domina has a free shuttle bus which goes to 2 different Metro stations (tube). Timetables are available from front desk and over the 5 days there, didn't have one which was late. Saturday & Sunday times are limited but still run from morning till early hrs. For those who haven't been to Rome before & book this hotel: If you land at Fiumiccino Airport, you'll see loads of taxis trying to get business, however you'll get charged loads for the trip because Domina is just outside the city. My advice is call the hotel and get pick up times from Travertino Metro and Cinecitta Metro, these are the 2 they drive to. Airport is linked to national rail, get ticket going to Termini Station (14 euros). At Termini (a line also on Metro) go to automated machine and press bottom left button on screen for English. Select timed travel up to 75 mins, put in a Euro for each person and get ticket. Get on your train to selected Metro station and then walk up to street like we do on UK Tubes. Then look out for silver small bus with Domina written all over it which will park near to exits. Jump on bus and it'll take you to hotel! We never got a day travel pass (4 euros each) because the Metro is only 1 Euro which lasts for 75 mins from time of purchase. Once in Rome you can actually walk to most attractions, unless you don't like walking. A little tip; When visiting Colosseum or Vatican, you will be hounded by tour operators trying to get your money. We did Colosseum because it wasn't too much of a difference and you get a decent tour of Palatines included which is opposite. The operators at Vatican start on you as soon as you get off Metro. They lie!! We had already decided not to get a tour, but were told by one set that normal ticket price into Museum is eu20 and they charge eu45 for tour, plus you get in and a tour of St Peter's included. They take you to the front of the queue which is a 2 hr wait. I heard the next person tell a family of four it would cost them eu35 each to get in and a 2 hr wait for the queue, so why not spend an extra eu10. The normal ticket price is Eu15 each. You can walk into St Peter's for free anyway. The tour may be helpful to some, but you can learn everything from the 'net. Is it worth an extra Eu30 each?! And the 2 hr wait they talk about, I timed it at 41 mins to entering through the front doors. There are so many restaurants everywhere, you'll get good deals so don't just walk into first one which says so. You don't need to keep buying bottled water, keep an empty one with you. There are fountains all over the place on the streets putting out water all the time. This is natural spring water! Hope this helps, you'll love it! The hotel is great and is only 10 mins on the shuttle bus, so book it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not read the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: redlac73
Reviews.Content: If you do your research before you go you can not fault this hotel For the people who said it is to far out of the City centre..........pay extra and stay in the city For people who complained about the staff....................People will speak to you the way you speak them. Food was very good, but if are "so set in your ways" and not prepared to try something different stay at home.............. Bon appetite This hotel is excellent value for money, clean, excellent and helpful staff Thank you to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjm27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Domina Hotel for three nights while visiting the historic center of Rome. The hotel is on the outskirts of Rome, but is an easy Metro and shuttle bus ride away. It was a good value for the quality of the hotel and with a little research work ahead of time, we were able to figure out the Metro station and bus number to use for traveling each day. The hotel has a shuttle bus that takes you to the Metro stop and will pick you up but be sure you figure out the shuttle schedule ahead of time. The hotel room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. The hotel breakfast was excellent with many choices of quality food. There is a great little pizza place just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find”
Reviews.Author: joeloaf
Reviews.Content: very accomodating staff in spite of all the languages, helped with all questions as long as you have the patience to wait your turn. great shuttle service to train but make sure you get on line early because it will be crowded. fabulous breakfast buffet . we did not use the tv but you have to pay extra for it . nice neighborhood one block to bus stop if you miss the hotel shuttle. Rome has excellent train, bus and tram system which you can use buying a pass for one day, three days or weekly, with access to all. saves alot of walking. hotel restaurant dinner very good but pricey

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing staff, hard to reach location, unreliable shuttle bus”
Reviews.Author: witterquick
Reviews.Content: Rachelheim 05's review is spot on. I stayed there with my brother back in April and as we arrived at 9.30 pm, we were relying on the shuttle bus being there to take us from Ciampino to the hotel. We waited until 11pm (it was due at 10pm) before calling the hotel as the bus was a no-show. The hotel staff refused to help - all they said they'd do is give us a phone number for a taxi company - when we tried them, they kept hanging up on us or sticking us on hold! The taxi cost us about 40 euros, and it was only a 5 min taxi ride! The second day - the bus that was supposed to pick us up from Cinecitta on the way back from Rome never showed up either, so we tried to walk back - big mistake, as we got completely lost. Wandering round some ghetto, we eventually found a deserted restaurant and the kind waiter managed to call us a taxi (it was a conversation of gestures, really). The taxi arrived and already had 8 euros on the meter before we even started the drive! Turns out we were 5 mins away but again, that was another 20 euros or so down the drain due to the shuttle bus being unpredictable. My biggest gripe about the shuttle bus is that you never know where you're supposed to be to get picked up - the airport staff said "terminal 3" but it never showed up there - we suspect it was up by the taxis, but we have no way of knowing. At Cinecitta, if you are taking the shuttle bus, wait outside the main entrance to the large pink building - do NOT cross the road (even though logically this is the route the bus should take!). Anyway, back at the hotel and we decided that enough was enough, we would buy 24 hours of internet access and check reviews of other hotels, with the idea of moving somewhere more central. The internet service (the one through the television) was just awful. The keyboard makes this maddening click every time you use the trackpad to move the mouse, very few websites actually worked (our idea of watching some twilight zone episodes on youtube was scuppered), facebook was messed up, hotmail wouldn't load etc. It took a bit of arguing but reception eventually took this off the final bill. They still charged us an extra day as we were leaving early... We ate in the restaurant one night. I think I had the same pasta as mentioned elsewhere on these reviews - very plain, it was simply chopped tomatoes, an onion and some pasta. Must have cost about 80p to make, but they charged about 8 euros Eventually we ended up moving to Hotel Windrose - the room was smaller, but in all honesty it was the best decision we made - much closer to rome and no more worry about commuting between Domina and Rome. The only reason I'd stay at Domina is if there was a conference or something at that hotel - otherwise, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for American travelers!!”
Reviews.Author: RevfromCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, first with my wife on 4/14-17/2010 and then again by myself on 4/28-5/1/2010. The service was one of the worst I have ever experienced at any hotel, anywhere, any star level. The staff definitely acted like they did not want to serve us because we were English speaking only and from America. The staff was rude and incompetent. The second time I checked in, the shower did not work. I called the front desk and the lady told me the maintenance person had already left for thte evening but they would take care of it the next morning! No apology, no sensitivity to the need for me to take a shower that night before I went to sleep. And there were plenty of other rooms available. This hotel is also not close to any of the Metro stops around Rome. So we had to depend on their free shuttle service. The drivers were nice and seemed competent. But the hotel management changed the shuttle times and did not even bother to notify the guests! At least not the English speaking guests. I go tthe definite impression this hotel caters more to Italian business travelers. Even though we got all our nights here for free using credit card points, we would never stay here again. The staff messed up my attempt to purchase some of their high priced internet connection time. There was also a bad smell on most of the second floor where I stayed the second time.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: emmettMoray_scotland
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my husband,we stayed in one of the superior rooms which only cost a couple of pounds extra.We couldnt fault this hotel it was really clean staff were very helpful ask them about buses or trains and you are supplied with a timetable for their shuttle bus and also a map of the sights around rome(without this map you would miss a lot of the sights). The hotel told us to catch the 664 bus which was a 10 minute ride to the nearest metro station,at the metro a ticket costing 4 euros got you an all day pass on the buses and the metro unlimited amount of journeys,The metro was really simple to use an idiot could do it,the furthest we travelled on the metro was to the vatican which took no more than 20 mins,we found more sights and shops from getting off at a stop called republicca and walking this is when you need the map from the hotel,we carried it every day each street was on it. Side street restaurants where much cheaper than ones beside the the tourist sights.lots of clothes shops to visit, Beware of the ques if you want to go inside the vatigan and the colisiam they are huge overall we really enjoyed our stay,the hotel isnt within walking distance from the centre of rome but rome is so busy it is great to sit in a quiet hotel. After staying at this hotel i am surprised at some things people have written,the hotel restarant staff were really friendly and helpful not just to us be to others,breakfast was great ,great selection to cater for all,one day the eggs were a bit runny but if you check another area they were fine.juice really cold and there was always lots to choose from,if you decide to get breakfast late maybe there wouldnt be as much left but this would be the same at any hotel,t.v wasnt a problem there were a few english channels bbc news cnn news and mtv was also sometimes in english,if you wanted to use the internet then yes you will be charged,again why be on holiday and be on the internet ???? myself and my husband are just under 6 ft and the shower was not a problem for us really powerful,there is no other mirror out of the bathroom but the one in our bathroom was huge and there was a socket right at it for dryer or anything else.bed was a bit hard but after the first night we got used to it.our room had a balcony that you have to get the bell boy to open we left this open most of the time and also during the night.Hotel prices are a bit expensive but its the same at each hotl,the shop just along from the hotel closes quite early so if your going back to your hotel late buy your juice in town as we didnt really walk fare from the hotel The title says it all well worth the money great hotel good location as easy travel with great sights would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not for first-timers to Rome or Europe for that matter”
Reviews.Author: rachelheim05
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 2 months before our trip and were excited at the prospect of staying in a 4 star hotel on this trip. We should have been tipped off when we had great difficulty communicating with the hotel when we tried calling one evening to confirm our reservations. (Tip: don't email them - they won't respond. Ever.) We were told we could arrange a hotel shuttle to pick us up from Fiumicino for 15 euro, so we did that. Upon arrival at the airport, there was no shuttle to be found. After wandering the airport and going desk to desk, we found a woman who seemed to know what she was talking about. She told us to wait at a certain area of the airport, and an hour later, nobody had shown. By luck we happened to run into the driver and the same woman told us to go with him. Now, don't set up this hotel shuttle. It took 2 hours to get to the hotel because get this - it took other people to other hotels too! It wasn't a private shuttle. And then, come to find out, it wasn't 15 euro, they mysteriously upped the rate to 18 once we arrived. The concierge staff wasn't exactly polite or welcoming by any means. I felt very put off by them, especially the men. Maybe it's because we're young American women. They didn't really care to answer our questions politely or in a timely manner. They did, however, feel it necessary to point out their restaurant downstairs many, many times, and not mention the local bus (more reliable than the shuttle at times) unless I specifically asked about it. I only knew about it from other reviews! They acted as though their hotel shuttle was the only means of transportation to the city. And then when I asked for information about the buses, they told me the wrong route back - DO NOT take the 664 back, unless you want to wander around residential, graffiti-covered Rome, lost, at night, with no map that even has this area of town and no telephone like I did. The room was fine, although we did request two twin sized beds and they kept shoving them together to make one big bed, even though every night we would separate them to make the point that no, we are NOT together, but every day we'd come back to them shoved back together. The shower is tiny - sprayed water all over the floor as there is only about a 15-inch glass divider, and had the faucet stabbing me in the thigh the entire time. I'm five feet tall and the showerhead was just above my head, I don't know how anyone any bigger or taller than me would be able to shower. My major gripes with the room are this: when you get to the room, your TV is basically the big flatscreen computer monitor. It has a cord that can be hooked into your laptop, but come to find out it's 10 euro for 1 hour of internet, 12 euro for 24 hours, and tv plus internet is some exorbitant amount that I don't remember. However, get this - if you go request wi-fi, it's only 5 euro for 3 hours if you use it wirelessly! Why in the world would someone pay 10 euro for 1 hour and a cord if they can get 3 hours without?! Silly. They don't tell you about the wi-fi unless you ask. My other major qualm - the maid. She rifled through our belongings almost every other day - we found our things in our suitcases rearranged, our stuff in the bathroom (toothbrushes and makeup and things) completely rearranged and almost put away, clothing put away, etc. This really bothered me. Make the bed, give me some clean towels, leave. Do not touch my things. Made me feel really insecure about my belongings. To turn the lights on, you have to have your key card in this little slot by the door. If one of you needs to go downstairs for something, and you take the card out and leave, all the lights shut off on your roommate. Neat. It also controls the AC, so when you come back from a long day in hot, sunny Rome, it's also hot in your room. Penny pinchers much? For what they're charging, you should at least be able to come back to a good climate (and your things where you left them!) Breakfast was alright. The same thing every day - cereal, breads and pastries, coffee, not nearly enough orange juice left out for everyone (and it's room temp and no ice to be found in the entire place, but it doesn't matter since it's either usually empty or there's no glasses around) and the worst - eggs that are basically a drink. I mean, really, Domina, are you that cheap that you can't even cook your eggs thoroughly? That qualifies as egg soup. It's basically a gelatinous mess in a pan. Leaving, we thought maybe we could arrange a similar shuttle back that we took in. We laughed when we heard the price. Remember that 15 euro that turned into 18 euro? Trips back are now 50 euro. Haha. Take the bus/subway/Leonardo Da Vinci Express train from the Termini for 15. It's worth it. Actually, just don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: tmccullough
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern. For the most part staff was friendly and helpful with answering questions. The breakfast was a nice start to a long day of sightseeing. Unfortunately, this hotel is located FAR from the sights of Rome. It's out in the suburbs. There are no restaurants, bars or stores of any kind near this hotel. The hotel does run a shuttle to the nearby metro stations, but it runs far too infrequently to be convenient. We relied heavily on the 654 bus to Cinecita metro station that comes just down the street from the hotel. It takes at minimum over an hour to get to the heart of Rome. I know you're probably thinking for the price, it's worth the inconvenience. But it's not. I spent half my vacation traveling to and from the hotel. We found it ridiculous that you have to pay for both internet and TV. TV was 20 euro for 24 hours. Internet was 5 euro for 3 hours. The room does not come with in alarm clock. Bring your own. There are also no mirrors outside the bathroom. We arranged a shuttle through the hotel to pick us up from FCO for what we thought was 15 euro. They outsource this to another company. The shuttle was full of other people needing to go to other hotels. We drove around for over 2 hours while the shuttle dropped other people off at their respective hotels. We were last since our hotel was so far out. It was a horrible end to a really long day of traveling. When we got the bill it actually cost 18 euro a person. At the end of the trip we asked to have a shuttle take us back to the airport and they said that would cost 50 euro. They told us a cab would be at least 60 euro. So we ended up leaving for the airport 5 hours before our flight to catch the Leonardo Express from Termini station. Also incredibly inconvenient. The hotel itself was not bad, but seriously, the location SUCKS.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: sldodge
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT hotel for our purposes. We just returned from a 4 day stay in Rome at the end of cruise and had booked this hotel for the value it offered. As everyone has noted, it is about 20 to 30 minutes by shuttle or bus and then metro to anywhere in Rome. The shuttle runs on time and offers plenty of options for both getting into and returning from town. We spent 3 days exploring Rome and we saw all of the major sights in both Rome and in Vatican City. Transportation was no problem and although we were prepared to take the buses if need be we were able to use the shuttle and did not need the bus. The hotel is probably the cleanest we have ever stayed in, the room was large and modern, and although the bed was a bit on the hard side compared to what we're used to we slept very well after full days of sight seeing. The breakfast offered a very good variety...eggs, bacon, potatoes, cheese and coldcuts, pastries, a variety of breads for making toast, cold cereals, a variety of juices and coffees, tea, etc. We arrived very early (around 10:45 .am.) and were given a room immediately even though check-in isn't until 2 p.m. and the front desk staff was very helpful whenever we had a question. There is a grocery store right down the street and an ATM, produce stand, and self-serve laundry services just a short walk away (left out the front door, down to the corner and grocery is on the right; go left and you'll find the ATM, laundry, and produce stand. They're all within a block or so and all located on the left.) Bus stops are within 1/2 to one block in just about any direction. And BTW, don't miss the view from the roof. You can clearly see the 7 hills of Rome, as well as some ruins and part of the aquaduct very close by. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend as long as you understand it is a little way out from the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very nice neighborhood. LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: XAMI
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and absolutely love it. Room is modern and clean. Fixtures inside are new. Bed - the best one. (Most N. American Hotels has soft mattress and my back could not stand it) My wife and I have the best sleep ever in all the hotels we have ever been. And TV - why would I bother with the TV programming choice? We come to Rome for the Colosseo and Roman Forum not the TV..... Breakfast is awesome - hot breakfast and fresh fruit and fresh yogurt. Make sure you have the espresso and cappucino - even it's from a machine inside the breakfast restaurant but it's good coffee my friend. We had full stomach every morning before hopping on a metro bus which take us to the nearby metro station less than 20 minutes. AND the bus is hardly full! To us we can experience how the local is doing - taking bus and metro - meeting people and that's the idea of traveling aboard. If you are so selective and insist of comparing what you have in your home country then why bother traveling - just stay at home. Having said that -the route 654 bus (bus station is just less than a minute walk from the hotel entrance) will take you to the second last station of the "A" line metro and the 663 bus will take you to the 8th station which both will take you to the tourist points in less than 20 minutes. We enjoyed the ride and all the colorful culture on the transport. Around the hotel there is a small-size supermarket called Todis and you can get your bottle water ($0.18 euro for 1.5 liter), drinks (like an OK bottle of wine only $2 Euro) and munchies. A cuban restaurant along the same road lead you to the supermarket and it opens from 8pm to midnight for very good food with good price. The hotel is also located close to an archeological site (On Via Appia Navona) and the ancient Roman Road (Via Appia Antica). So don't complaints of the hotel being far away from attraction. Staffs in the hotel speaking good English and been very helpful - from shuttle, ordering taxi for us such and such. We only used shuttle service once, just we want to be more flexible on our schedule. In general, we highly recommend this hotel. Yes, it may not be right at the tourist spots downtown in Rome, but it's not that far away - seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & served its purpose but .......”
Reviews.Author: JELST
Reviews.Content: Firstly .. Mother alone with teenage daughter (that in itself was a little daunting!) staying 4 nights on a budget! I found this hotel on a 'special offers site' about 6 months ago and only paid £27 pppn including an upgrade to a superior room/full breakfast as it was a surprise birthday present for my daughter. I do not believe our room was 'superior' or that our breakfast was any different to anyone elses! Room was clean and comfortable and served its purpose. There is absolutely nothing to do at this hotel. NO TV! unless you pay 20 euros for TV/internet for 24 hours. No tea/coffee facilities in room - take your travel kettle. No mirror in bedroom - ladies if your taking straighters/hairdryer then pack an extension lead so you can view yourself in bathroom mirror! The Reception staff/Porters were friendly/helpful,although at times I believe they only understood what they wanted to understand. The Restaurant staff were extremely rude, unhelpful, ignorant and would turn there back on you. As we arrived early eve in the pouring rain, tired and not wanting to venture out in the dark we asked if we could have some sandwiches - the kitchen said "No!" I was not prepared to pay the average cost of 20 euros per person for a main meal from a poor menu (8 euros for 2 cokes) - so for the first time in all my years we went to bed hungry. But it was not our plan to spend much time in the hotel so things could only get better .... AND THEY DID! Woke to sunshine, filled our tummies with breakfast (a fair choice but nothing like shown on website!) and ventured out. Get map from hotel lobby - has every street name on it and was a godsend (even though we had brought our own - it was this one we used all the time) Firstly we took the hotel mini-bus, this drops you at a Metro and away you go! These hotel buses are free and drop-off/pick-up at various Metros at various times of day. They only hold 25 persons, so the sooner you find your own way using local buses, the better as 50 people queueing for same bus does not work, especially in the evening when tired and just want to get back! At the Metro you can buy your ticket(s). We bought a 3 day ticket allowing us unlimited use of tube/buses for 11 euros each. TRANSPORT: We found the local buses from near hotel brilliant; easy, convenient and hassle free and ran every 10 mins to and from Metro stops. Note: if your using these at peak times the traffic is mad and will add a little time to your journey (daughter thought this added to the whole adventure ha!) If you would like more info on this - please contact me. I don't know which buses a previous reviewer used we could be at a metro stop in 15 mins max!! TRIPS: If you have children over 12 then SEGWAY tour is a must - definately a highlight of the holiday and the guides are great. If your planning on going to VATICAN then please purchase a queue jumping ticket - even at 8.45am Alton Towers peak season is nothing compared to this!! Both trips were purchased via www.viator.com FOOD: Wherever you are, go off down a side street where its cheaper. They do not have any problem with 2 people sharing one meal i.e. daughter and I often shared a pizza (as they are huge), which is ideal if you have children with you with smaller appetites as 'kids meals' are unheard off! Our meals averaged 20 -30 euros for two people inc. main meal, soft drink and an ice-cream or crepe. DO NOT EAT AT THE CAFE OUTSIDE COLOSSEUM METRO - RIP OFF. 17 euros for 1 x coke and 1 x French Fries. Unfortunately this was the one and only time I didn't ask for the bill - I didn't make same mistake twice! ALWAYS ask for bill and check it - they really do try it on! But being a single female with no male partner in tow I did feel unable to argue back - these people can be quite aggressive! TAXI: Do not take a taxi from outside Airport - extortionate anything from upto 80 euros quoted for a 10 minute journey. You should be paying no more that 20 euros (for 2 people) from Ciampino Airport to Hotel and make sure you have hotel address as no-one has ever heard of this hotel! We did pay 40 euros but I had previously arranged this online - a private car with the man coming into airport and holding up a sign with our name on. Taxi's tend to add 10 euros for each additional person! The hotel can arrange a taxi for you but make sure its a taxi and not a private car, although they do run a FREE shuttle bus but not regularly and unfortunately didn't co-inside with our flights. All in all we had a fab time and would definately go again and to same hotel now that we have learn't from our mistakes; found our way around and just used the hotel for its purpose - somewhere to lay our heads at night! Definately a business hotel NOT a leisure hotel. Just one more thing: I HAVE NEVER MET SUCH RUDE, IGNORANT PEOPLE AS THE ITALIANS. IT IS A CASE OF "IF YOU CAN'T BEAT THEM - JOIN THEM" or you will get nowhere! PLEASE DO NOT HESITATE TO CONTACT ME - IF I CAN DO IT - YOU CAN - IT REALLY IS EASY!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bebykitty
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a week long trip in Rome and stood at this Hotel. This was a great stay for the price. The hotel is not located directly in Rome, however we did not mind that, as it was very nice to come back to a quiet neighborhood at the end of a long day of sightseeing. We are from Los Angeles so we also did no mind the 15 minute ride that the hotel shuttle provides each day to metro stations, that is less than our average commute each morning to work. The schedule includes a variety of departures and returns and will take you to several metro stations that lead to the main station in Rome (Termini), where you can get to all the major sites/attractions from. If for some reason the schedule does accomodate your plans, bus number 654 from Cicenitta Metro Station will take you to/ from the hotel, (literally from right in front of the hotel) and you will more than likely run into other individuals on there way to/back, which is kind of nice. The hotel is clean and very modern. They serve a nice breakfast each morning from 7a-10a and it's more than just continental. They have a bar and restaurant (limited menue) on site, but the neighborhood around the hotels is also a nice place to stroll around and get a slice of pizza or sandwich from. The front desk staff is also pretty helpful and most of them speak/understand English. The only small issue we encountered was we arrived earlier than the 2p check in, so we had to wait a bit for our room to be ready, but it wasn't that bad. I would definetly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty neat and comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: JarusGoa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Domina Roma Capannelle in the second week of March 2010 for 2 nights. It is a modern hotel with spacious rooms. The bathrooms are very neat and clean except for the shower in my room which was broken. Did not have any meals in the hotel except for the breakfast, which was very nice and had a good spread. I did not have much interaction with the hotel staff..so ca not comment on that aspect.Its bit far from the the city, but since we had the tour coach/bus, did not have to worry about the travel. I would put this hotel in business category rather than one for leisure/relaxation. Overall pretty descent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: manzarelli
Reviews.Content: Let me say this first, we rented a car so we had total freedom over our vacation which I would recommend to anyone in spite of the crazy driving habits of Italians. Also, parking at the hotel was free so we were sold. Now, because we had a car anything and everything was at our convenience. It is a 15 minute drive from the hotel to the Coliseum so it is where you want to be. Plenty of dining choices nearby and for treats/drinks a supermarket is right around the corner. Do be aware, if you put something in the fridge they will throw it out so only use it then remove in the morning. We were travelling with our 7 year old daughter and found the hotel to be most pleasing as it had to have been the newest hotel in the area. We are simple travellers that dont need the frills of a 5 star this or that. Italy and Rome for that matter has been the best trip we have ever taken to Europe and we have been to Ireland, Spain and Portugal. Anyone that puts so much weight into a hotel or room is bound to always be disappointed and even then i can't imagine anyone being dissapointed with this hotel. Happy Travels!!

Reviews.Title: “glad to back home”
Reviews.Author: ratt1990
Reviews.Content: located in the ghetto, and a royal pain to get to any sight seeing interests, the Domina is a 1.5 star hotel at best. Allow yourself 1/3 of each day just to get to and from downtown Rome. our group of 8 (from the USA) spent at least 3 hours of each day waiting for buses, the Metro (train), and walking from bus stops where no bus ever showed up, admiring the grafitti art on EVERY building in the area, dodging dog fecis on the sidewalks, then getting to hotel and told that the restaurant was closed (even though the Italian diplomats guests were feasting on pasta and veal), trying to get served in the lobby bar is a joke, couldn't get a cold beer, or ice (dont you dare ask for a bucket of ice!! if so, you will get a saucer filled with 6 cubes), being scolded for taking 2 crackers from the "snack table" If you dont arrive in time to eat at the restaurant, be prepared to starve. there are no nearby restaurants for late night dinning, heck, you dont want to walk around the grounds at night anyway. The lobby bar closes early and it is forbidden to raise your voice and have a good time. we were told on numerous occasions the keep our voices down, at one point the bar was packed with 50+ thirsty guests that were willing to pay the $8 USD prices for a beer, but the servers could not care less if they ever sold one drink, we even tipped generously and had the Euros pushed back at us, and bartenders backs turned to us. basically the staff is racist against Americans, nobody smiles, or greets you with any enthusiasm (maybe that is just how Europeans are) shuttle bus drivers dont even try to talk to you, front desk staff was better, but always combative with a "you can't do this, don't do that" attitude. be prepared for mis information at every turn, i dont think the staff intentionally lies to you, its just that nobody is on the same page and doesnt know simple things like how to work the in-room safe, what time do the shuttles arrive and depart, how to charge a meal to your room, etc. the luxaries of the USA dont exist in this hotel and for the most part anywhere in Rome (i will say that there were clean and private restrooms everywhere in Rome even in the dumpiest pizzarias and at the sites, i was surprised) TV and showers were a joke. Ever showered without a shower curtain or shower door and flooded the bathroom floor? well, be prepared for that too. dont loose your room key or the lights in the room wont work, so you better have good aim in the middle of the night for a bathroom break. once you finally get into the city, all is good. great history, sites and action. cabs are a rip off, take the train and bus if you must. but the key is to stay in the city and not in the suburbs, traffic and driving tactics are very stressful, you cannot come and go anywhere with ease, be prepared for long days, lots of walking, and most importantly, when you want to come back the Domina after a long day and want sip on your favorite drink and eat an authentic Italian meal at the hotel, it aint happening. this hotel is for the local Italians, not tourists. it was very evident that they do not cater to non-Italians, they dont want our money or tips, there is no sense of urgency at this hotel. its socialism at its best. Pay more and stay downtown Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Rooms were spacious and comfortable! The food was good.”
Reviews.Author: PraveenSuravanditha
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly we did not feel like we were staying in a European hotel! The Rooms were spacious and comfortable! The food was good. This hotel is not close to the center of the city for sure. Good if you have taken care of the transportation needs if not be aware of a Subway available in a 15min walking distance. We had a nice pool view room and the sight was serene. There are paid TV channels be aware it is at extra cost if you view some of the channels. Hygiene factor would score well. The hotel has an eye knocking shape on the exterior! Overall a comfortable hotel. The flip side is that the room service was just ok. Explore, Experience, Enjoy… Suravanditha Praveen Kumar

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - great staff - great location away from the noise!”
Reviews.Author: selleca1
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel, very modern and customer oriented. The staff was superb. The rooms were extremely clean, plush, comfortable. The reception staff - front desk - was beyond helpful. They were young, extremely poised and professional, always cheerful, helped us with our plans and every need. Superb. The breakfast that was included with our plan was expansive, fresh, and just perfect. The bar has a wonderful atmosphere and offers great food and snacks in the late afternoon. Domina is also set up as a conference hotel. I can see why it would be superb as such. Domina is located a little "out of the way" in southeast Rome...but just a couple blocks from public transportation (free) to the metro/subway (1 Euro) which will take you to most any location or within walking distance of most everything in North and Central Rome and even within walking distance of the Vatican complex in the west. The value of this gem of a hotel is wonderful and we liked being away from some of the street noise of central Rome. It is also located within walking distance of several good little restaurants and a market. We already miss our front desk friends: Giuseppe, Sabrina, Monia, and the others. Excellent service the whole stay! Debbie Sellers Linda Conrad Paula Neece

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: HMEUR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, clean, and has good amenities. But was made this hotel so great was the conceirge. They were not only great at answering all our touristy questions (providing directions, etc.) but went over and above when I got sick. I told a lady at the concierge desk if she could tell me where the closet clinic or hospital was, and she said that I would spend all day in the waiting room if I went there. So she called a doctor to visit me in my hotel room who was there within an hour. The doctor's english wasn't great, so the lady from conceirge also served as a translater. I wish I got her name; I'm really appreciative of what she did.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EVER COME HERE, EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: USTica01
Reviews.Content: Hmm, where to start... I had set up a pick up w/ the hotel from Fiumicino by email and also confirmed it by phone 2 weeks before arrival and they never showed up. The hotel staff was rude and did not care that no one came to pick me up. I set up a wake up call for the following day... NO WAKE UP CALL! Thank god this wake up call was for a tour and NOT a flight, otherwise I would've missed my flight. If you put in a drink or food into their minibar fridge, they throw it out without telling you. And they also turned off the mini fridge from the reception desk without telling me since I put a drink in that wasn't theirs in there. Prices for their food are outrageous, and certainly without reason bc the food is terrible. The breakfast was the same everyday, the eggs were mushy and watery, service was slow to refill and did it with their usual nasty attitude. Francesca was the worst front desk person out of them all. Asked to speak with the manager, waited half an hour and he never came out. Victor who works in maintenance was the ONLY person in that hotel who cared to help us in any way he could, he was VERY nice. Hotel shuttle is very inconvenient and you must pay 1 euro per person each way, leaves you at a metro station w/ very infrequent stops. Public transportation is better, about 5 mins away. Even though you pay for it, don't expect these people to lift up a finger for you, they are terrible and can certainly ruin your trip. This hotel relies on the fact that perhaps once it provided good service and us fools go there thinking "oh it's a good hotel". You couldn't pay ME to stay here ever again. You will find at least one thing to disappoint you about this hotel everyday, mark my words. And they will do NOTHING to try to change that or make up for it. Other than that, RUN FOR THE HILLS AND DO NOT STAY IN THIS DISGUSTING HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: EnglandThemis
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 40 minutes out of rome, the shuttle bus is not free and only takes you to the underground where you have to travel approx 10 stops. the service in dining room is appalling and the breakfast the worst we have ever had. scrambled egg floating on cold milk among other things do not stay here if you dont want to waste your money

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, but far from the sights”
Reviews.Author: traveler1Morocco
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was beautifully done, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was also very good. The only problem was that it was not only far from the sights of Rome, but also far from a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Abolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: eddy111
Reviews.Content: Good Side ;- Staff ever so helpful.Hotel was very clean.Room cleaned and bedding changed every day.Hotel had free coach to Met station/Campino Airport and back,also picked you up in Rome twice a night at set times(9.00pm and 12.00pm).Breakfast consisted of Scrambled Egg,Bacon and Sausage,Various Cereals,Fruit,Various Fruit Juices,Hot Drinks.Cakes to die for. Down Side ;-A little off the beaten track but once you know the way it is very easy.Bar prices expensive.No Tea/Coffee making facillities in room was charged 4 euros for pot of hot water with 1 tea bag.

Reviews.Title: “Restful, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: laycockmel
Reviews.Content: While outside the city center, this hotel is worth the drive. Relaxing, restful and lovely rooms! The pool and patio areas are clean and well manicured! The breakfast buffet is delicious and filling! The hotel provides shuttle service to the airport's and subway. Bus service located 1 block from hotel. It was nice to do our sightseeing and then return to use the pool and relax. Definitely would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “very good standard continental hotel-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AJHEngland
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not close to metro (4 kms) but operates a shuttle coach. If you organise yourself around these times, it works. Very friendly staff, willing to give info on shopping, bus routes, tourist sites etc. Room very clean & spacious. Patio doors have to be opened & closed by staff as they consider it a security & safety issue. We had no problems as air -con was extremely efficient and we did not need to sit out. Can be organised but no furniture. Superior rooms provide swimming towels. Breakfast can be taken outside or in and was of a good standard-a varied selection though not enormous. Smoking allowed outside. A plus is that this hotel operates a free shuttle to & from Ciampino- other contributers to this site have stated how taxi fares can be exhorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, fair location”
Reviews.Author: Stealthray
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Domina hotel for a business trip because of work activities close to the hotel location. I had a two room suite for the accommodation. Good creature comforts within the room. The only downside is an expensive and somewhat slow internet connection when using your personal laptop. They also offer an in-room computer setup providing internet access but this option is extremely slow. You also must choose between personal laptop or in room computer for internet as you cannot use both for just one price. The free breakfast in the morning offers ample opportunity to cover your basic eating habits. The hotel has a local arrangement for reasonable taxi rides to and from the airport. We were able to fit four + luggage into a station wagon cab to Fiumicino airport for only 60EURO total. As noted in previous reviews, the hotel bus does go to the metro/downtown area but the scheduling is somewhat inconvenient and you could end up going by the Ciampino airport enroute adding on to the total trip time. Otherwise, the public buses 654 and 664 offer good connections to the metro and then the metro takes you near most of the tourist sites. Both the bus and metro had reasonably safe atmospheres and cost about 4E for a 24hour pass. In summary, a decent hotel but not a convenient location to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly hotel, great access to Rome”
Reviews.Author: 5foot18
Reviews.Content: Hotel in quiet neighborhood, great price at 80 Euro, stayed 2 nights got 3rd night free. Room was very elegant and well appointed. Breakfast was included and comparable to cruise ship in variety of foods; fresh pastry, meats, eggs, fruit, great coffee and espresso, we loved it. Interesting local restaurants near by, especially Italian and Cuban. Hotel south of city, provided shuttle bus (see photo) delivery and pick up from train station and metro, made travel into Rome and back a snap every day, and only 1 Euro. Only one negative. The answers from staff to questions about when the pool (closed entire stay) would open, varied from "it is not currently legal to use the pool" to "closed for cleaning."

Reviews.Title: “Very American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brandywhyne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and we loved it. The rooms were very nice and the staff was great. Breakfast was an american style buffet that included scrambled eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, brioche, cake, juice, etc. We ate enough to hold us over to lunch time! The only negative for this hotel is that it's a little ways outside the city (which is what we wanted) but the bus stop to return to the hotel was on a busy four lane highway. Also, there was only one restaurant in walking distance and so if we didn't eat dinner in Rome center, there was only one option for us to eat. I enjoyed the restaurant (Hotel Girasole) but after a few days, the menu was no longer exciting. Overall, I think this was a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, Helpful staff, See other side of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Brownybros
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome for a 5-day trip with friends and found this place as a way to save on hotel and also see what else Rome has to offer other than the central area. First, the hotel is situated about 10 miles out of the central city. The location seems calm, local and residential. A few restaurants (a Cuban, a Pizzeria, and an italian) are nearby. Definitely worth the short walk. There's really no need for renting a car as the Hotel offers a shuttle at 50 cents (euro) to several transportation centers, including the subway. Also, a block away is a bus stop and its very easy to navigate in them buses. A bus pass is only 1 euro (for 75 minutes) and also covers the subway. The staff speaks English and are extremely helpful. They can connect you to any type of tour or service. The rooms are good. They are clean and comfy, yet small. The beds are small and very close to one another but they are comforntable. Each room offers a flat screen tv, but very few channels and the only American channel is CNN, which can be boring after 5 minutes. Also, the internet isn't too good to use, but if you're desperate, try it at 7 euro for 24 hours. The restroom is fine in space, however, the shower has no shower curtain and you depend on a glass than only covers 1/4 of the shower space, so make sure you place lots of towels on the floor because you'll splash lots of water during showers. The biggest flaw at this hotel is the food. We ordered room service once from the hotel restaurant and the food was terrible. However, the hotel offers free breakfast every morning and that at least taste good. Well if you do want to visit Rome and would like to see what people in Rome are all about and save money while you're at it, then stay here. The place is nice and away from the fast-pace central part of Rome. Just understand that it takes at least 20 minutes to get to the inner city from the hotel using the various transportation methods. Take advantage of the city tours offered. They are usually 19-20 euro for 24 hours... pay 5 euro more and get 48 hours. They are hop-on-hop-off, so they are very convenient and they cover areas not reachable by subway. The buses come around every 20-30 minutes, so they give you plenty of time to visit every destination and in Rome there are many, many spots to visit and take a ton of pictures. The City is beautiful and rich in history. Also, every salesperson and souvenir stand speaks and/or understands english, so visiting Rome is a simple task for any American.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Michigan_Samper
Reviews.Content: I took my first trip to Europe during Easter Week 2008. I arrived on March 18 and left on Easter Sunday. There was definitely both good and bad about this hotel. First, the good: Communications via email directly with the hotel prior to my arrival were wonderful. They were prompt with answers to all of my questions and were quite polite and accommodating. I asked about transfers from FCO and they arranged for Rocco Lavarone to pick me up and then return me to the airport. I don't recall the price, but I was traveling on a budget, so it must have been reasonable. I have to say that it was wonderful to have Rocco waiting with the Hotel Sign for me as I got off a long and uncomfortable flight, which arrived a little early. He was very personable, spoke English very well, and was full of information on what we were passing, what to do, etc. I HIGHLY recommend Rocco! His business card says "ryderrome.com", but I haven't looked at his website. Upon check in, things went smoothly. There was no problem with my early arrival and the room was waiting for me, but they were aware I'd be there well before formal check in time. The hotel NEVER seemed crowded to me during this popular week, but maybe I was coming and going at "off hours". The staff, however, was not "thrilled" with my arrival nearly as much as I was! There was a definite "distance" with them. I decided to celebrate my finally getting to Roma by ordering a drink at the bar off the lobby to take to my room while I settled in. I asked for Rum and "Coke Light". I have never seen such inefficiency in my life for such a simple thing. The bartender couldn't figure out how to pour the rum! It wouldn't come out of the bottle, so I suggested taking the pourer off assuming the cap hadn't been removed, which she couldn't manage. I ended up with 8 ounces of Coke Light for 4 Euro. At the time, exchange was a whopping USD $1.60, so this was a very expensive little non-drink! The toilet took some figuring out.. you have to push BOTH buttons on the wall for a flush. Make that a TURBO FLUSH. Water pressure was very good! Otherwise, the room was exactly as shown on the website. Spotlessly immaculate, cleaned every day (my diary indicates one day the room wasn't made up by 2:30PM, however), and spacious by any standards. The furnishings and all amenities were of very contemporary and thoughtful design as well as of high standards and quality. I knew ahead of time about the door to the balcony and asked for a handle, which they gave to me for my entire 6 night stay. I didn't have to call each time I wanted to open the door. Do this at check in and you won't have a problem at all. Balconies are all just one long veranda with just a waist high metal pole diving each room's space. NOT private by any means, but every time I stepped out, I was completely alone... not much balcony action in March. If it were summer, though, I wouldn't be thrilled with the communal balcony. The roof terrace would be wonderful in the summer, but again, I was there in March, took in the vista, and went back to the room. The pool seemed like it would be very nice in the summer as well. I had a ticket to see the Necropolis at the Vatican the day I arrived, which I made in very good time via the shuttle to the Metro. The shuttle ran about hourly in the morning, with only 2 returns in the afternoon before switching to the downtown schedule for the evenings. I was always one of maybe 4 or 5 other guests, so the shuttle was fine. HOWEVER, do NOT be even one minute late for the shuttle either way! The driver is VERY punctual and waits for no one! I missed the time by only 3 minutes and had to sit on the curb at the Metro until the next one one day. They should put some benches around the Metro station! The day I had a ticket to the actual Vatican, I missed it by less than 5 minutes and had to figure out the bus situation on spur of the moment to make my tour. VERY unpleasant. The driver is not an extraordinarily pleasant man, but he got me where I had to go. That first night, I was exhausted having arrived, getting to the Vatican, taking a tour, and then making my way back to the hotel, so I took a look at the room service menu. OUCH! An easily finished steak (I'm a woman, so not the appetite of a linebacker), a small "garnish" of rocket salad and some cold breads (no butter) was 25 Euro. At the exchange of $1.60, I vowed this would be the only room service item. The mini bar was ridiculously expensive (I think it was 6 Euro for an airline sized spirit) as well, so I stayed out of that and opted for Vino from the market down the road... Only 1.70 Euro for a nice bottle of Merlot! WATER was more expensive! The complimentary breakfast was adequate, but the same every day... Scrambled Eggs, bacon, sausage, fruits, breads/rolls/pastries, juices, cold cuts and cheeses. Several times, the hot foods were only luke warm/bordering on cold at best. Quantity didn't seem a problem, but I'm an early riser and was always there at the start of service. My internet service didn't work (7 Euro/24 hours) even after having "The Guy" take a look at it. They were kind of rude, implying that I was doing something wrong and were "put out" by having to come take a look. Turned out "The Guy" couldn't make it work, either. After a few days, they suggested I change rooms, so I packed everything up and waited. And waited. Then, "The Guy" came back and miraculously, the Internet worked. I think they gave me 24 hours free for the inconvenience. It was VERY unpleasant to not be able to check in at home when I wanted to, but Massimo offered his office computer to do so. Since it wasn't truly urgent, I didn't want to put him out of his office and declined. The movie "Grease" was playing on Pay Per View. For TEN Euros! Is that crazy or what? That was over USD $15 for a decades old movie that most have seen a zillion times already! TV was a disappointment. I think only 2 English (news) stations (CNN and Europe MSNBC). Once you watch the news cycle, though, the repetition will drive you mad. I was forced "in" on my last day due to rain, and was glad I had The DaVinci Code to finish. Watching the Italian soap operas was funny, though. You don't need to know what they are saying to find amusement in their overly dramatic theatrics. My bill (I prepaid the entire stay for a discount) with my "extras" on it was off by 59 Euros. It took quite a conversation with Reception to straighten it out. I was holding my receipt , folded up, and the Receptionist (Ana Maria) practically grabbed it away from me for "proof" of the charges. It really made me quite angry that she would just lunge for something in my hand while insinuating I was a liar. She left a very bad taste in my mouth with her attitude. If you can stand the confinement of the Shuttle schedule, this hotel is great for the price. However, a VERY accurate watch and the willingness to take a little time to get to the sites is mandatory if you are counting on the shuttle service. It wasn't horrible, but it was confining and uncomfortable at times if you had to wait at the Metro station for any length of time. The Metro (Line A), by the way, was very clean, dependable, and easy to use. If I can use it after a 10 hour flight on my first day in Roma, anyone can! Line B isn't as nice and new, but efficient nonetheless. I didn't see any sort of crime, petty or otherwise, during my many Metro rides. I NEVER used it alone after dark, however. Summarizing, VERY clean, very modern hotel, with adequate breakfast. Location in the neighborhood isn't convenient if you want to walk to dinner somewhere.
