I arrived after a 20 minute walk at the Sunflower restaraunt (recommended by front desk) at 7PM and they weren't even open yet. Front desk should have known and revealed such a thing as they watched me head out the door. Plus, it was dark at 7PM in March... kind of a creepy walk alone when it got to be much further than "5 minutes" from the hotel. I probably shouldn't have been so bold to walk alone after dark. Front Desk personnel (Ana Maria, specifically) and Shuttle Driver could use some etiquette lessons, charm school or something similar. TIP: There is a "strip mall" across the street from the pool. Go there in the morning to get some nice fresh fruit for the room. Also, there is a Pharmacia there for the basics. I liked that I could get an asthma inhaler without a prescription for only 4.50 Euro without having to shelp around trying to find one. Finally, there is a nice little "deli" there where you can buy things like salami by the pound and other snacks for the room. To do it all again? I'd probably stay closer to the City Center or at least very close to the Metro if site seeing was the purpose of the trip. I found location to be this hotel's biggest drawback.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dsappointing”
Reviews.Author: romevisitor100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply too far from Central Rome. Although it is modern and clean with rooms that are larger than typically found the remote distance from central Rome makes it a very poor choice. The hotel's website claims it is a 15-minute drive to central Rome. Not so! A cab ride (cost=40 Euros) will take 20 to 30 minutes. The hotel shuttle, a 15 minute ride to the second last subway station on the Red line, runs on a limited schedule. If you use the shuttle you will still have a 20-30 minute subway ride to get into central Rome. The hotel is located in a residential area. There is a small grocery store and bar within a couple of blocks. You will need to take the hotel shuttle to the subway stop to find other shops/services. The hotel's restaurant offers a very limited bill of fare. There is no concierge service and no gift shop or store from which newspapers can be obtained. The Internet service is marginal. If you brought your laptop with you the Internet connection will work. If not, you use the pay-to-use Internet On TV service. The daily charge is comparable with other hotels. However, the Internet On TV service is extemely frustrating for anyone with any Internet experience. The staff is okay but will not go the extra yard to help you.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay, IF...”
Reviews.Author: mcoffeesnob
Reviews.Content: As of this date i'm still here at the hotel. I'll start with the GOOD: The hotel is SPOTLESS! For all you germ-a-phobes, you will love this one. The neutral: The staff is gracious, but rather cold-weather we are speaking italian OR english. The Bad: Location, location location The UGLY: Shuttle service (though i'm grateful) has huge gaps in it. For example in order to leave (TAXIS are 20 Euro from here to the city-EACH WAY), I have to wait THREE hours for the next shuttle to take me to the metro, then take the metro for 20 minutes to get to the city. There's so much to see in Rome, I don't want to miss a minute. My advice? If you want to see the sights (who doesn't) consider getting a hotel that may not be as new, but is closer to the city. Time is money, don't waste your time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but stay clear of the bar”
Reviews.Author: markos50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a residential suburb of Rome, strange place really. The hotel shuttle bus picks up from Ciampino airport and is, I think, timed to meet ryanair flights. The shuttle bus is great, it drops you off at the metro and picks up in central Rome at 21:40 get there 10 mins before pick up. The hotel is very clean and serves a purpose, the staff are however, a little tense and seem unsure how to be friendly and relaxed. Breakfast is good with lots to choose from, however beware of the bar and the food. in out opinion it is way ,way overpriced ; 6 euro for a small bottle of beer. Stock up from the shop 50 yards down the road to the left as you leave the front door. The pool was good and we always got sunbeds. Stay again? yes certainly + buy a Roma pass, available from the main train station in Rome next to platform 23 or 24.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel as I really wanted a hotel with a pool not too far from Rome City centre. Although the website does not show the pool area, it is adequate with sun beds and the hotel provides towels from 10am. On arrival from Ciampino airport, I was surprised that although the hotel is ten minutes from the airport the taxi cost was 30 Euros as this is a minimum fare from the airport! The hotel is very modern, a typical business/ conference hotel. The restaurant and bar area was small but nice. Food good but very expensive for what you got. A can of coke cost 4 Euros! There is a local small grocery shop about a five minute walk from the hotel where you can get drinks though. Breakfast was basic but nice, quite a limited buffet selection but adequate. There are no other restaurants within walking distance to the hotel as it is located in a residential area. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the nearest station which is then only twenty minutes into the centre of Rome. If you are happy to work around the times of the shuttle service then it works very well. They provide two evening shuttles from the centre of town back to the hotel (9.40pm & 11.40pm) and this only takes about 20 minutes. Overall this was a very nice hotel that catered to the requirements I had for my stay and would definitely go back should my requirements be the same the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and expensive food”
Reviews.Author: Hannabd
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself is simple but clean and nice. However, the service is poor. We had dinner there in the evening and the food was not as nice as all of the other we had in Italy. It was also overpriced. Our room was ok but the A/C started leaking in the middle of the night and the noise woke us up. Switching it off was not an option because of the heat. You couldn't open the windows. I am really not fussy but it was unbearable. We had to move room at 3am! In the morning, the breakfast was poor. On leaving, we had no apology or even a mention of the fact we changed room. We stayed there only one night on the way out of Rome. It is very handy for Rome Campino airport.

Reviews.Title: “In Rome for sightseeing? Do yourself a favor and stay in a hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler068
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a vacation in Rome, Italy. Assuming that I can get a higher class hotel for a lower rate outside of the city, I booked the Domina Roma hotel in Capannelle. Well, this appeared to be a terrible mistake... Don't get me wrong, the hotel is nice and fancy, everything is pretty new and clean, the staff is helpful and the hotel is located in a quiet village - which appears to be the main problem... I tried getting there from the De Vinci airport by public transportation (a taxi is 70 Euro), which appeared to be a hard task for a non-Italian speaker... It took me about 3 hours to get there, from which at least one hour of hiking with all my luggage in hand... After the long hiking I arrived at the hotel; they couldn't find my booking for about 10 minutes, but eventually gave me a room. I planned to join guided tours in Rome with a company that works with the hotel (every reasonable hotel offers this kind of service). At the reception desk I got a booklet with the offered guided tours of the company that they work with, and the time table for the hotel's shuttle. But here is the problem - there is no correlation between the shuttle and the time tables of the guided tours, and the tours company picks their clients from their hotels, but not from this hotel as it is too far from the city. Example: the tour to the Vatican leaves from the center of Rome at 07:30, but the first shuttle leaves the hotel after 8am... The hotel’s staff was kind enough to teach me about the public transportation (there is a bus stop right next to the hotel). To get to the city center at 07:30 using public transportation I had to leave the hotel at 06:30. Breakfast? - They start serving it at 07:00.... I'll save you the time reading the details of the rest of my experience in the hotel (dog barking in the 3rd floor corridor in the middle of the night, terribly thin walls between the rooms, and so on...) and just summaries by saying that if you plan an event in Rome this hotel may be a good choice as it is pretty fancy for the price. But, if you are in town for sightseeing, do yourself a favor and stay in a hotel in the city, even if it is not as fancy...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: padmeshj
Reviews.Content: We had booked our stay for 3 days and two nights in the hotel. We had rented a car with GPS system for our stay in Rome. The hotel is little difficult to find based on the '37, via siderno' address even with the car GPS system. After trying too many times GPS refused to find the correct address and provide us with a route to get to the hotel. Finally we called up the hotel on which the receptionist told us to put the name of the main street as '37, Via Appio Claudino' instead of 'Via Siderno'. The new street name worked and we were able to reach the place where there were boards all over giving directions to Domina Hotel. Mind you that '37, Appio Claudino' is still not the correct address. The correct address is '37, Via Siderno' but that doesn't work with GPS systems. On reaching hotel, we found the staff to be friendly and the rooms very neat and clean. The hotel itself is quite new and modern. It is in a lovely and peaceful residential area. It has small well-maintained swimming pool which is quite welcoming in hot summers. We had access to 3 lifts to get to our room on second floor. Our room was quite spacious and well decorated with modern amenities. The only thing missing from the room was an electric kettle to prepare hot tea water. Though this was sorted by paying only one time room service charge of 5 euros and getting the tea served to your room everyday in the morning. Breakfast is quite okay and does not contain too many items apart from croissants, breads, jams, butters, juices, bacons and eggs. Car Parking is not a problem as there are some free parking spaces in front and behind the hotel. I am not sure about the availability of public transport from the hotel to the center of Rome. But I am sure there are some hotel provided shuttle buses running everyday to take you to center of Rome as well as to the airports. By car we could reach any place in Rome within 20-40 minutes. We checked out on the third day as planned, but ended up missing our return flight. We called up the hotel to accommodate us for one more night and they were prompt to take us back and gave us the same room all cleaned and tidied as usual. On the whole it was a pleasant experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to those who have their personal transport and would like a quite peaceful time away from the humdrum of Rome City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Comfort_Traveller29
Reviews.Content: The advantage to staying at a hotel out of town, is that it is a lot quieter than something that we have had downtown. Huge disadvantage is the distance away, and the dependence on the hotel shuttle or public transportation. I found the hotel transportation adequate, we never had a problem getting on the shuttle for our time, but found the bus driver quite rude. We tried to go into town on a Saturday, but neither the front desk staff that we had asked a question to, or the bus driver found it pertinent to advise us that the subway was closed until 2 pm. Might have been helpful information considering the shuttle dropped us off at the subway station! Thankfully, there was a mall nearby the drop-off point that we entertained ourselves at until the subway opened. The public transportation bus into town and out of town is adequate, and inexpensive as an alternative to the hotel shuttle. Average experience over all, nice room, quiet, took a long time to replenish the food at breakfast, and the staff always seemed to act as if they were extremely put out if you asked them for service during breakfast. Stayed in for dinner one night and was disappointed by the food quality and portion for the price. Service at the front desk also seemed to depend on who was currently working. The pool was not open for any of the 6 days we were there. But the pool area itself was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we stayed in on our recent business trip in Europe. It's about 15 mins from the city centre by cab (30 Euro) and about 15 mins from Ciampino airport. It's NOT close to Fiumicino. The hotel seems pretty new, and the cab driver wasn't too sure where it was, but the sat nav got us there. Reception is huge, and there seemed to be a lot of people milling around. Only one guy on reception trying to do everything, so it all took a bit of time to check in, book cabs, alarms etc. But he was very polite, if a bit distracted by the endless queries from the enormous Korean tour groups who kept fussing about their rooms. Room was pretty big, felt quite plush. Very clean. Nice new bathroom too. Only problem was that it wounded like there was a stream running overhead - something to do with the aircon, and I couldn't make it stop. Out with the ear plugs again. No noise from the corridors though, or from outside. There was wireless internet and also a network connection cable, but it was an extra cost (12 Euros for 12 hours) which was added onto the bill. Breakfast was extra too, but since we had an early start, we didn't try it. Overall, it was quite a nice hotel, and I'd have been happy to stay there a bit longer. But only for business, it's too far out from the centre to be a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It´s like a Ferrari, running with a Bettle engine.”
Reviews.Author: MarcosSix
Reviews.Content: I don´t want to let our bad weather experience in Rome interfere with this review. The Domina Campanelle is very nice and modern, as well as the rooms, bathrooms, breakfast area, almost everything. The first issue, anyway, has to be about the location: it is very far from the city center, and even to the closest metro station (Cinecittá), which is around 20 minutes by bus from the hotel. We were aware of that and only decided to book it anyway because the price was attractive and they offer a complimentary shuttle bus to this station. We believed the location issue could be overcome this way. The main problem is that there is only one small minibus, and no hotel policy to deal with the problem when it got filled. Once the guests understood that they don´t organize a line, each trip became a “run for your life” competition. Really unpleasant experience, and the only one who seemed to be enjoying was the bus driver, with his nazi look, telling the guests that there was no more room for anyone. That was when I finally understood why the hotel is named Conference... because that´s what they always started each time the bus was filled. Guests, manager, driver, arguing about what to do next as if it wasn´t obvious that the driver would have to come back to finish his job. It could even be funny if there wasn´t the cold, the rain, the bad mood of the driver, etc. Another big issue is about it´s time schedule. There are only two trips from the metro station back to the hotel in the afternoon: one at 14:30 and the other at 18:30. You can imagine how crazy it may get the battle for a seat in the bus. And obviously, the “conference” that started right after. But there are still other issues. For instance: the door from the room to the balcony doesn´t have a handle. You have to call the reception and ask them to send a guy to open or to close it, which may be annoying when they are busy and it takes like half an hour to open or close a simple door. The air conditioning digital control panel is impressive. Could be better if it worked properly, but we needed to call the reception everyday to ask them to reset the system, as they explained to be necessary. The minibar, the lobby bar, room service and the restaurant are incredibly expensive, but there aren´t many options in the neighborhood, so be prepared to get ripped off. Talking about rip off, the taxi fare to get you from the airport to the hotel is twice the fare we paid to fly from Barcelona to Rome. Obviously, this is not a hotel´s fault... but is worth mentioning. After all, the Domina Campanelle could be a magnificent hotel to stay, if they solved these problems which sound minor if compared to the investment they faced to build up that beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AliciaV
Reviews.Content: A very impressive and beautifully equipped hotel. However, we hired a car at Ciampino and simply *could not find this hotel!* I speak fluent italian and we stopped to ask directions many many times. No one had heard of it. After 2 hours, we were just about to go back to the airport and get a taxi to lead us, when I saw a small sign. We followed it down dead-ends and up dead-ends and finally, when hunger and exhaustion had reduced me to tears, we pulled up and asked the Carabinieri. Success! We arrived at 1am. The room entry cards didn't work so we had to slog back down to reception. There was only one food item available from the room service menu and absolutely no wine available. My friend told them not to be so ridiculous - there *had* to be wine in a 4* hotel (he was very tired, hungry and fed up) but we were told that all the wine was locked in the kitchens and no one had the keys. There was a mini bar in the rooms, containing exhorbitantly-priced spirits and when our room service arrived, looking very grand on a trolley with white tablecloth etc., there was an even more exhorbitantly-priced bottle of mineral water in a wine cooler. Talk about insult to injury! Horrid area, good breakfast, the building is all too technically challenging for me personally. The only bit of modern electonics that I liked was the lights coming on automatically as you walk along the (incredibly long) corridors to your room. Moral of story? Do not try and find this hotel on your own without a taxi (if you are lucky enough to find one who knows where it is). Do not try and find it alone and without spoken italian, broad daylight, a full stomach and plenty of spare time.

Reviews.Title: “Rome vacation”
Reviews.Author: sapphiredragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a vacation to Rome. The rooms are spacious, clean, and modern. Bathroom is also nice and clean great too. Very comfortable stay. The hotel's complimentary breakfast is very good. However, we tried room service for dinner, just OK but expensive. Hotel is located miles away from central Rome and also not within walking distance to the metro. Not too many things around hotel as situated more in housing area. The hotel does provide a shuttle to the metro during the day and from central rome at night, so you'll have to plan your schedule around the shuttle's schedule. Heard that a public bus services the area near the hotel and can get you to the the metro but we never tried it. Call hotel to get the shuttle times and see if it might fit your schedule. If it fits your needs as it did ours, it is very convenient. Sure it would have been great to stay at a hotel right in town so you can walk right out the front door and start exploring. However, the price was good, the room was nice, and the free shuttle, makes up for the location. The staff is OK, not very friendly, probably will not go the extra mile to help you. Being not in central Rome, the staff may not deal with a lot of tourists so they were not helpful when it came to answering some of our questions. So prepare for your trip and don't count on getting answers from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mariasolis1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec 14-18, 2007. We took a 40 Euro Taxi ride from Fiumancino (30 minute ride). The neighborhood is fine, just working class and quiet. The shuttle was a great help getting in and out of Rome (took us to the metro station, way faster than driving! ) Be sure to double check their phone numbers though, we tried calling the hotel and got the incorrect numbers off of their website. Also important to note, when being picked up by The Victor Emanuel Monument, you will actually be getting picked up in front of the theater of Marcellus by the restaurants (you will see all the parked cars and the bus double parking in front of them to pick you up). We figured this out the hard way, chasing after the bus. Other than that, best hotel stay we had in Italy. Clean, modern and extremely thoughtful. Also the absolute BEST breakfast we have had in Italy. Fresh fruit, eggs, bacon (pancetta, but hey I'm not complaining), yogurt, coffee. My room had a great view or room while my mother had a nice view of the neighborhood. They were extremely helpful and allowed us to check in early (no extra charge) since they know we had a long flight from Los Angeles. Very Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: tangobravoh
Reviews.Content: After my 12 hour journey from the Bahamas, this Hotel is all the reviews said it would be. It is definitely above average. There are 'marble like' tiles in the bathroom and countertops, electronic lights controlled from anywhere in the room. The room service was prompt and delicious. Be careful, in Italy ive found that the soda water is popular, check the labels before u crack the seal on the water in the minibar. The room was modern, clean, beautifully accented and the bed was very comfortable. I was on my honey moon so i spent alot of time in it. The hotel is a bit away from the city. Its in a residential area and the ride into the city is a bit of a hassle. But U only gatta do it once a day. The hotel bus shuttles you to and from the Cincetta stop and the bus times are a little inconvenient but what i didnt know was that the 654 runs from Cincetta to footsteps away from the hotel. Keep ur eyes peeled tho, cus u may miss ur stop. All in all, it was a fabulous stay, the breakfast was delicious. The staff is multilingual and the taxi ride from Ciampino cost me 20euros. Enjoy. Id definitely reccomend it and lookin forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: OneGlove
Reviews.Content: We chose the Domina Roma as it looked quite new and modern in the pictures and it had some good reviews on Expedia and Trip Advisor. I have to say that we were not disappointed. The hotel was spotless in terms of cleanliness and maintenance. The cleaner always seemed to be around the lobby cleaning something and obviously taking pride in his work and the hotel. The rooms were modern and as you’d expect from a 4 star hotel with comfortable beds and a clean bathroom. It is a shame you could not open the French doors which would lead out onto a balcony. Hotel service was great as was the bar itself. 15 euros for a bottle of Pino Grigio and all the olives, nuts and crisps that you can muster. Also they did bring out a selection of other snacks free of charge. The bar area was a pleasure to sit in to chill out and the outside area was again immaculate Breakfast was ok, sausage, bacon and scrambled egg, selection of fruit juices, yoghurts, breads, cheeses, ham etc. The hotel is a little out of town but we did not have a problem with that whatsoever. The free shuttle service was excellent, always on time and never full for us. It either takes you to the Metro station (10 mins) or into the City centre (40 mins) in the night time. The Metro then costs either 1 Euro for 75 mins use or 4 Euros for 24 hours use (both unlimited travel). The shuttle does always pick you up from the same place as it drops you off. Do not panic if when waiting at the Metro it drives around the corner – it will be back, it’s just going round the block! Obviously a must is a visit to the Coliseum. If you take the Via San Giovanni in Laterano from San Giovanni Metro I would recommend Anfiteatro for lunch. It is right near the Coliseum so you can see it and it was very friendly, inexpensive, clean and tidy which some of the restaurants most certainly weren’t! There are a couple of restaurants near the hotel itself. Girasole wasn’t very good. My pizza arrived literally 5 minutes after I ordered it (too quick!) and then my wifes food arrived 5 minutes after that (too slow!). Another restaurant which was recommended to us but we didn’t go to is Antico Miglio. It is the opposite direction to Girasole and you will pass it on the shuttle bus. It is just past the supermarket. Give it a try – I wish we had! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. The fact it’s out of the city centre isn’t a problem with the free shuttle service, it’s actually nice to get away from the hustle and bustle and get back to a nice quiet area. It is only 10 mins taxi drive to the airport (Ciampino) and will cost you 15 – 20 Euros. The hotel is very modern, clean and tidy and delivers a good professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: smartnik007
Reviews.Content: i had a great experience with the staff at this hotel near Ciampino airport. On the day I had planned to sleep there, I found out I had booked for a night later. I had booked and paid online so it was not able to change the reservation on short notice like that. The staff could've had me pay for the night and not take care about the voucher. But they were very helpful and I ended up not paying anything more than the voucher I had already paid. We had a great room too, clean, modern. Parking is not included in the price, but even the staff told us we could park on the street for free. The surroundings aren't great, but if you have a car, it's no big deal. I'd recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, modern base for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JEaston
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in September. Agree with other reviewers who found the out of town location easily compensated for by the efficient hotel minibus transport to and from the metro during the day and from the centre of Rome during the evening. Quality of rooms, breakfast and value for money excellent. Pool v cold but pool area fine for a couple of hours relaxing between a busy day in Rome and evening. Highly recommended for those who prefer a more modern hotel environment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: We are an early 50s couple who stayed for a long weekend (first trip to Rome) which generally we thoroughly enjoyed. The Domina Roma is a good modern hotel with large comfortable rooms. The internal public spaces are bright, modern, perhaps a little clinical, but fine. The hotel is new, and the outside pool area still undergoing finessing. Sceening was taking place during our stay (Aug 17-20) which we thought was overdue. Some foliage in the outside space would help. The roof-top area is currently unoccupied wasted space. In reality though Rome, is not a place where many would plan spending much time at the hotel. The dining arrangements were OK, no better than that. Breakfast served its purpose, but wasn't memorable, and the one evening we dined in the restaurant was disappointing. In fairness, we did feel that the food we had throughout our stay in Rome was pretty average (tourist fayre) (apart from Ice-Cream cones which for non sweet eaters were fabulous, huge and cheap 2Euros). Our biggest disappointment was location. The hotel really was in an odd place. It seemed to be in the middle of a pretty desolate housing area with lots of shuttered businesses and residencies. We later discovered this perhaps related to timing, as our stay coincided with the Rome holiday when businesses close and people go on holiday. It did mean that there was absolutely nothing near to the hotel by way of a shop, bar or restaurant. Maybe other times the area is more vibrant. This meant the courtesy shuttle (or taxis) was even more critical. Public transport we found ideal once you got the hang of it. The shuttle made regular trips to the Metro (Traversini), and that took you into the City. A bus (No 664) could take you back to the hotel from the Metro if you arrived at a non shuttle time (your Metro ticket covered that journey too). Be warned, others have referred to the shuttle bus to and from the City in the evening. It only does 2 trips, one returns about 2100hrs which is pretty useless timing, the other at 2315hrs, when our experience was it got over full (no standing allowed). On our first night we were amongst a few left stranded and had to take a taxi for most of the journey as public transport was over for the area of the hotel. People in the same situation said it had happened most nights that week. We got back to the pick-up 25 minutes early the following night and only just got a seat. (The hotel needs to review this problem). Rome itself was stunning, every corner seemed to bring you to a standstill. Very touristy and interesting, expect to queue at the Vatican (a must even for agnostics), St Peters was hugely impressive, climbing the steps to the top was a challenge but worth it, even for the view regardless of the significance of the location. Remember to take sensible walking shoes, we didn't and our feet paid the price. Rome, so much to see, so much recognisable European history. Advice for travellers arriving at Ciampino. Take a taxi to the hotel. The public transport alternative via Anagnina we couldn't fathom on arrival or departure, and took a taxi from there, which cost much the same as to / from the Hotel (14 Euros) which would have been far easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not a great location!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeyP
Reviews.Content: Everything is brand new, hi-tech and very swish, as you’d expect from a four star hotel! The revolving doors even know you’re when you’re approaching. Which is nice. The only problem is that its so far away from the city centre. Which I guess isn’t a problem if you’re arriving by taxi or limo (as any self-respecting four star hotel client should!), but if you’re relying on public transport to get there, it’s a big problem. There is a regular bus service from the nearest underground station, but it takes about 15 minutes. There is a free hotel minibus service to and from the underground station, but that only runs at certain times (a timetable is available at reception). The staff were very helpful though, so nothing was difficult to understand. The late-night pick-up from the city centre by minibus was also a life-saver. Trying to negotiate public transport late at night would have been a nightmare. Just a word of advice on that though – make sure you know where the bus is going from! I had a mad dash around trying to find it, and only just made it with two minutes to spare. The driver was prompt in departing (and rightly so). But if transport isn’t a issue, I can thoroughly recommend the hotel in itself. The breakfast was very good too, with a large buffet of lovely stuff. Another bonus is that it’s very close to Ciampino airport, only 10 minutes by taxi, which worked out at about 15 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: jenMLondon
Reviews.Content: We went as a young couple for a few days to Rome booked last minute - the hotel as lovely (although the pool was closed whilst we were there which was a let down), gorgeous rooms and just a short trip from the city centre (with a free shuttle bus that takes you to the metro line) ! The hotel is in a quiet location although there are local restaurants/pizzerias and supermarkets if you just ask at reception they are very willing to help and give directions! There is nothing in the way of evening entertainment so I suggest you take a pack of cards and monopoly! However, take a bottle of wine up onto the roof garden (no seats up there but floor is nice) at sunset and look out over to Rome (this means you turn right out of the lifts and go through the doors) from there you can make out st peters and the vatican which's lit up once dark falls-a gorgeous view! Just a warning when you get to the airport if you want a taxi make sure it's a local taxi with the taxi sign on the roof (they are white) there are private taxis but they will overcharge to 200% and they will lie and tell you there are no other taxis available - from airport leonardo di vinci (Fliminco) it should cost you 25-30 euros. All in all a very good hotel if you really want to sight see!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal escape from Rome rip offs”
Reviews.Author: HobartResident
Reviews.Content: At the end of a 4 week trip around Italy we decided to look for a hotel near Ciampino airport and avoid the hassle and frustration of staying in central Rome and enduring the expensive and very poor standard hotels. This hotel was a real find. It is very new and in enthusiastic start up mode with everyone going out of their way to assist. The rooms being new are spotless, modern and contain all the facilities you would expect. We were greatly surprised by the quality of the food and service in the a la carte restaurant, a sort of Italian/English/Asian fusion with a great wine list and in our Italian experience very reasonably priced. The breakfast the next day was everything you would expect of this fine hotel. There is plenty of parking, the hotel operates various shuttles, so if you don't need to stay in the centre of the very dirty and pickpocket ridden Rome and are happy to make a great saving, do your self a favour and stay here before everyone gets to heear about it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Capannelle
HotelInfo.Address: Via Siderno 37, 00178 Rome, Italy
